1.verse: [ Forsooth for many men endeavoured to ordain the telling of things, which be filled in us,

2.verse: as they that saw at the beginning, and were ministers of the word, betaken,

3.verse: it is seen also to me, having from the beginning all things diligently by order, to write to thee, thou best Theophilus,

4.verse: that thou know the truth of those words, of which thou art learned.]

5.verse: In the days of Herod, king of Judaea, there was a priest [there was some priest], Zacharias by name, of the sort of Abia, and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elisabeth.

6.verse: And [they] both were just before God, going in all the commandments and justifyings of the Lord, without plaint.

7.verse: And they had no child, for [that] Elisabeth was barren, and both were of great age in their days [and both had gone far in their days].

8.verse: And it befell [Soothly it was done], that when Zacharias should do the office of priesthood, in the order of his course before God,

9.verse: after the custom of the priesthood, he went forth by lot [by sort he went forth], and entered into the temple [of the Lord], to incense.

10.verse: And all the multitude of the people was withoutforth, and prayed in the hour of incensing [praying in the hour of incense].

11.verse: And an angel of the Lord appeared to him, and stood on the right half of the altar of incense [standing on the right half of the altar of incense].

12.verse: And Zacharias seeing was afraid [And Zacharias seeing was distroubled], and dread fell upon him.

13.verse: And the angel said to him, Zacharias, dread thou not; for thy prayer is heard, and Elisabeth, thy wife, shall bear to thee a son, and his name shall be called John.

14.verse: And joy and gladding shall be to thee; and many shall have joy in his nativity, or birth.

15.verse: For he shall be great before the Lord, and he shall not drink wine nor cider, and he shall be full-filled with the Holy Ghost [and he shall be filled of the Holy Ghost] yet from his mother's womb.

16.verse: And he shall convert many of the children of Israel to their Lord God; [And he shall convert many of the sons of Israel to the Lord God of them;]

17.verse: and he shall go before him in the spirit and virtue of Elias; and he shall turn the hearts of the fathers into the sons [and shall turn the hearts of the fathers into the sons], and men out of belief to the prudence of just men, to make ready a perfect people to the Lord.

18.verse: And Zacharias said to the angel, Whereof shall I know this? for I am old, and my wife hath gone far in her days.

19.verse: And the angel answered, and said to him [And the angel answering said to him], For I am Gabriel, that stand nigh before God; and I am sent to thee to speak, and to evangelize to thee these things [and to evangelize, or tell, to thee these things].

20.verse: And lo! thou shalt be dumb, and thou shalt not be able to speak till into the day, in which these things shall be done; for thou hast not believed to my words, which shall be fulfilled in their time.

21.verse: And the people was abiding Zacharias, and they wondered, that he tarried in the temple.

22.verse: And he went out, and might not speak to them, and they knew that he had seen a vision in the temple. And he beckoned to them, and dwelled still dumb.

23.verse: And it was done, when the days of his office were fulfilled, he went into his house.

24.verse: And after these days Elisabeth, his wife, conceived, and hid her(self) five months, and said [saying],

25.verse: For so the Lord did to me in the days, in which he beheld, to take away my reproof among men.

26.verse: But in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God into a city of Galilee, whose name was Nazareth [to which the name Nazareth],

27.verse: to a maiden [to a virgin], wedded to a man, whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the name of the maiden was Mary.

28.verse: And the angel entered to her, and said, Hail, full of grace; the Lord is with thee; blessed be thou among women.

29.verse: And when she had heard, she was troubled in his word, and thought what manner salutation this was.

30.verse: And the angel said to her, Dread thou not, Mary, for thou hast found grace with God.

31.verse: Lo! thou shalt conceive in [the] womb, and shalt bear a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus.

32.verse: This shall be great [He shall be great], and he shall be called the Son of the Highest; and the Lord God shall give to him the seat of David, his father,

33.verse: and he shall reign in the house of Jacob without end [and he shall reign in the house of Jacob into without end], and of his realm shall be none end.

34.verse: And Mary said to the angel, On what manner shall this thing be done, for I know not man?

35.verse: And the angel answered, and said to her, The Holy Ghost shall come from above into thee, and the virtue of the Highest shall overshadow thee; and therefore that holy thing that shall be born of thee, shall be called the Son of God.

36.verse: And lo! Elisabeth, thy cousin, and she also hath conceived a son in her old (age), and this month is the sixth to her that is called barren;

37.verse: for every word shall not be impossible with God.

38.verse: And Mary said, Lo! the handmaid of the Lord ; be it done to me after thy word. And the angel departed from her.

39.verse: And Mary rose up in those days, and went with haste into the mountains, into a city of Judaea. [Soothly Mary rising up in those days, went with haste into the hilly places, into a city of Judaea.]

40.verse: And she entered into the house of Zacharias, and greeted Elisabeth.

41.verse: And it was done, as Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the young child in her womb gladded. And Elisabeth was full-filled with the Holy Ghost [And Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost],

42.verse: and cried with a great voice, and said, Blessed be thou among women, and blessed be the fruit of thy womb.

43.verse: And whereof is this thing to me, that the mother of my Lord come to me?

44.verse: For lo! as the voice of thy salutation was made in mine ears, the young child gladded in joy in my womb [the young child gladded with joy in my womb].

45.verse: And blessed be thou, that hast believed, for those things that be said of the Lord to thee [for those things that be said to thee from the Lord], shall be perfectly done.

46.verse: And Mary said, My soul magnifieth the Lord,

47.verse: and my spirit hath gladded in God, mine health [mine health-giver].

48.verse: For he hath beheld the meekness of his handmaiden. For lo! of this all generations shall say that I am blessed.

49.verse: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things, and his name is holy.

50.verse: And his mercy is from kindred into kindreds [from kindreds into kindreds], to men that dread him.

51.verse: He made might in his arm, he scattered proud men with the thought of his heart.

52.verse: He put down mighty men from their seats, and enhanced meek men.

53.verse: He hath full-filled hungry men with goods [He hath filled hungry men with good things], and he hath left rich men void.

54.verse: He, having mind of his mercy, took Israel, his child;

55.verse: as he hath spoken to our fathers, to Abraham and to his seed, into worlds.

56.verse: And Mary dwelled with her, as it were three months [Forsooth Mary dwelled with her as three months], and turned again into her house.

57.verse: But the time of bearing child was fulfilled to Elisabeth, and she bare a son.

58.verse: And the neighbours and the cousins of her heard, that the Lord had magnified his mercy with her; and they thanked him [and they together joyed to her].

59.verse: And it was done in the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child; and they called him Zacharias, by the name of his father.

60.verse: And his mother answered, and said, Nay, but he shall be called John.

61.verse: And they said to her, For no man is in thy kindred, that is called [by] this name.

62.verse: And they beckoned to his father, what he would that he were called. [Soothly they made a sign to his father, whom he would him to be called.]

63.verse: And he asking a stylus [a pointel], wrote, saying, John is his name. And all men wondered.

64.verse: And at once his mouth was opened [Forsooth his mouth was opened anon], and his tongue, and he spake, and blessed God.

65.verse: And dread was made on all their neighbours, and all these words were published on all the mountains of Judaea [on all the hilly places of Judaea].

66.verse: And all men that heard putted in their heart, and said, What manner child shall this be? For the hand of the Lord was with him. [And all men that heard put in their heart, saying, Who guessest thou, this child shall be? And soothly the hand of the Lord was with him.]

67.verse: And Zacharias, his father, was full-filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, and said, [And Zacharias, his father, was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,]

68.verse: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, for he hath visited, and made redemption of his people.

69.verse: And he hath raised to us an horn of health in the house of David, his child.

70.verse: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets, that were from the world.

71.verse: Health from our enemies, and from the hand of all men that hated us [and from the hand of all that hated us].

72.verse: To do mercy with our fathers, and to have mind of his holy testament.

73.verse: The great oath [The oath] that he swore to Abraham, our father,

74.verse: to give himself to us. That we without dread delivered from the hand of our enemies, serve to him [That we delivered from the hand of our enemies, serve to him without dread],

75.verse: in holiness and rightwiseness before him in all our days.

76.verse: And thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Highest; for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord, to make ready his ways.

77.verse: To give science of health to his people, into remission of their sins;

78.verse: by the inwardness of the mercy of our God, in the which [in which] he springing up from on high hath visited us.

79.verse: To give light to them that sit in darknesses and in the shadow of death; to direct [to dress] our feet into the way of peace.

80.verse: And the child waxed, and was comforted in spirit, and was in desert places unto the day [and was in desert till the day] of his showing to Israel.

1.verse: And it was done in those days, a commandment went out from the emperor Augustus [a commandment went out from Caesar Augustus], that all the world should be described.

2.verse: This first describing was made of Cyrenius, justice of Syria [justice, or keeper, of Syria].

3.verse: And all men went to make profession, [or acknowledging,] each into his own city.

4.verse: And Joseph went up from Galilee, from the city Nazareth [of the city of Nazareth], into Judaea, into a city of David, that is called Bethlehem, for that he was of the house and of the family of David,

5.verse: that he should acknowledge with Mary, his wife, that was wedded to him, and was great with child. [that he should acknowledge with Mary, spoused to him wife, with child.]

6.verse: And it was done, while they were there, the days were fulfilled, that she should bear child.

7.verse: And she bare her firstborn son, and wrapped him in `clothes, and laid him in a feed-trough [and put him in a cratch], for there was no place to him in no chamber.

8.verse: And shepherds were in the same country, waking and keeping the watches of the night on [upon] their flock.

9.verse: And lo! the angel of the Lord stood beside them, and the clearness of God shined about them [and the clearness of God shone about them]; and they dreaded with great dread.

10.verse: And the angel said to them, Do not ye dread; for lo! I preach to you a great joy [lo! soothly I evangelize to you a great joy], that shall be to all people.

11.verse: For a Saviour is born to day to you, that is Christ the Lord, in the city of David.

12.verse: And this is a token to you; ye shall find a young child wrapped in `clothes, and laid in a feed-trough [and put in a cratch].

13.verse: And suddenly there was made with the angel a multitude of heavenly knighthood, praising God, and saying,

14.verse: Glory be in the highest things to God, and in earth peace be to men of good will. [Glory in the highest things to God, and in earth peace to men of good will.]

15.verse: And it was done, as the angels passed away from them into heaven, the shepherds spake together, and said, Go we over [till] to Bethlehem, and see we this word that is made, which the Lord hath made, and showed to us.

16.verse: And they hieing came, and found Mary and Joseph, and the young child laid in a feed-trough [put in a cratch].

17.verse: And they seeing, knew of the word that was said to them of this child.

18.verse: And all men that heard wondered, and of these things that were said to them of the shepherds.

19.verse: But Mary kept all these words, bearing together in her heart.

20.verse: And the shepherds turned again, glorifying and praising God in all things that they had heard and seen, as it was said to them.

21.verse: And after that eight days were ended, that the child should be circumcised, his name was called Jesus, which was called of the angel, before that he was conceived in the womb.

22.verse: And after that the days of the purification of Mary were fulfilled, after Moses' law, they took him into Jerusalem, to offer him to the Lord,

23.verse: as it is written in the law of the Lord, For every male-kind opening the womb, shall be called holy to the Lord;

24.verse: and that they shall give an offering, after that it is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons [or two culver birds].

25.verse: And lo! a man was in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon; and this man was just and virtuous, and abode the comfort of Israel [and this man was just and dread-full, abiding the comfort of Israel]; and the Holy Ghost was in him.

26.verse: And he had taken an answer of the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, but he saw first the Christ of the Lord.

27.verse: And he came in Spirit into the temple. And when his father and mother led [in] the child Jesus to do after the custom of the law for him,

28.verse: he took him into his arms, and blessed God, and said,

29.verse: Lord, now thou lettest go thy servant after thy word in peace; [Lord, now thy leavest thy servant after thy word in peace;]

30.verse: for mine eyes have seen thine health,

31.verse: which thou hast made ready before the face of all peoples;

32.verse: light to the showing of heathen men, and glory of thy people Israel.

33.verse: And his father and his mother were wondering on [upon] these things, that were said of him.

34.verse: And Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, his mother, Lo! this is set into the falling down and into the rising again [into the falling and into the rising again] of many men in Israel, and into a token, to whom it shall be against-said.

35.verse: And a sword shall pass through thine own soul, that the thoughts be showed of many hearts.

36.verse: And Anna was a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the lineage of Aser. And she had gone forth in many days, and had lived with her husband seven years from her maidenhood.

37.verse: And this was a widow to fourscore years and four; and she departed not from the temple [which departed not from the temple], but served God night and day in fastings and prayers.

38.verse: And this came upon them in that hour, and acknowledged to the Lord [And this in that hour above coming, acknowledged to the Lord], and spake of him to all that abided the redemption of Israel.

39.verse: And as they had full done all things [And as they had perfectly done all things], after the law of the Lord, they turned again into Galilee, into their city Nazareth.

40.verse: And the child waxed, and was comforted, full of wisdom; and the grace of God was in him.

41.verse: And his father and mother went each year into Jerusalem [And his father and mother went by all years into Jerusalem], in the solemn day of pask.

42.verse: And when Jesus was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem, after the custom of the feast day.

43.verse: And when the days were done, they turned again; and the child abode in Jerusalem, and his father and mother knew it not.

44.verse: For they guessing that he had been in the fellowship, came a day's journey, and sought him among his cousins and his acknowledged.

45.verse: And when they found him not, they turned again into Jerusalem, and sought him [seeking him].

46.verse: And it befell [And it was done], that after the third day they found him in the temple, sitting in the middle of the doctors, hearing them and asking them.

47.verse: And all men that heard him, wondered on the prudence and the answers of him.

48.verse: And they saw, and wondered. And his mother said to him, Son, what hast thou done to us thus? Lo! thy father and I sorrowing have sought thee.

49.verse: And he said to them, What is it that ye sought me? knew ye not that in those things that be of my Father [wist ye not, that in those things that be my Father's], it behooveth me to be?

50.verse: And they understood not the word, which he spake to them.

51.verse: And he came down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject to them. And his mother kept together all these words, and bare them in her heart [bearing together in her heart].

52.verse: And Jesus profited in wisdom, age, and grace, with God and men.

1.verse: In the fifteen year of the empire of Tiberius, the emperor, when Pilate of Pontii governed Judaea, and Herod was prince of Galilee, and Philip, his brother, was prince of Ituraea, and of the country of Trachonitis, and Lysanias was prince of Abilene,

2.verse: under the princes of priests Annas and Caiaphas, the word of the Lord was made on [upon] John, the son of Zacharias, in desert.

3.verse: And he came into all the country of Jordan, and preached [preaching] baptism of penance into remission of sins.

4.verse: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias, the prophet, The voice of a crier in desert [The voice of one crying in desert], Make ye ready the way of the Lord, make ye his paths right.

5.verse: Each valley shall be full-filled, and every hill and little hill shall be made low; and depraved things shall be into dressed things, and sharp things into plain ways; [Each valley shall be filled, and each mountain and little hill shall be made low; and shrewd things shall be into dressed things, and sharp things into plain ways;]

6.verse: and every flesh [and each flesh] shall see the health of God.

7.verse: Therefore he said to the people, which went out to be baptized of him, Kindlings of adders, who showed to you to flee from the wrath to coming?

8.verse: Therefore do ye worthy fruits of penance, and begin ye not to say, We have a father Abraham; for I say to you, that God is mighty to raise of these stones the sons of Abraham [soothly I say to you, God is mighty of these stones to raise the sons of Abraham].

9.verse: And now an ax is set [is put] to the root of the tree; and therefore every tree that maketh not good fruit, shall be cut down, and shall be cast into the fire [shall be cut down, and sent into the fire].

10.verse: And the people asked him, and said [saying], What then shall we do?

11.verse: He answered, and said to them [Soothly he answering said to them], He that hath two coats, give he to him that hath none; and he that hath meats, do in like manner.

12.verse: And [the] publicans came to be baptized; and they said to him, Master, what shall we do?

13.verse: And he said to them, Do ye nothing more, than that that is ordained to you.

14.verse: And [the] knights asked him, and said, What shall also we do [Forsooth and the knights asked him, saying, What shall and we do]? And he said to them, Smite ye wrongfully no man, neither make ye false challenge, and be ye satisfied with your wages [and be satisfied with your wages].

15.verse: When all the people guessed, and all men thought in their hearts of John, lest peradventure he were Christ,

16.verse: John answered, and said [saying] to all men, [Soothly] I baptize you in water; but a stronger than I shall come after me, of whom I am not worthy to unbind the lace of his shoes [of whose I am not worthy to unbind the thong of his shoes]; he shall baptize you in the Holy Ghost and fire.

17.verse: Whose fan in his hand/Whose winnowing tool is in his hand, and he shall purge his floor of corn [and he shall purge his corn floor], and shall gather the wheat into his barn; but the chaff he shall burn with fire unquenchable.

18.verse: And many other things also he spake, and preached to the people. [Forsooth and he stirring, or admonishing, many other things, evangelized to the people.]

19.verse: But Herod [the] tetrarch, when he was blamed of John for Herodias, the wife of his brother, and for all the evils that Herod did,

20.verse: he increased this over all, and shut John in prison.

21.verse: And it was done, when all the people was baptized, and when Jesus was baptized, and prayed [and praying], heaven was opened.

22.verse: And the Holy Ghost came down in bodily likeness, as a dove on him; and a voice was made from heaven, Thou art my dear-worthy Son, in thee it hath well pleased to me.

23.verse: And Jesus himself was beginning as of thirty years, that he was guessed the son of Joseph, which was of Heli,

24.verse: which was of Matthat, which was of Levi, which was of Melchi, that was [which was] of Janna, that was of Joseph,

25.verse: that was of Mattathias, that was of Amos, that was of Naum, that was of Esli, that was of Nagge,

26.verse: that was of Maath, that was of Mattathias, that was of Semei, that was of Joseph, that was of Juda,

27.verse: that was of Joanna, that was of Rhesa, that was of Zorobabel, that was of Salathiel, that was of Neri,

28.verse: that was of Melchi, that was of Addi, that was of Cosam, that was of Elmodam, that was of Er,

29.verse: that was of Jose, that was of Eliezer, that was of Jorim, that was of Matthat, that was of Levi,

30.verse: that was of Simeon, that was of Juda, that was of Joseph, that was of Jonan, that was of Eliakim,

31.verse: that was of Melea, that was of Menan, that was of Mattatha, that was of Nathan, that was of David,

32.verse: that was of Jesse, that was of Obed, that was of Booz, that was of Salmon, that was of Naasson,

33.verse: that was of Aminadab, that was of Aram, that was of Esrom, that was of Phares, that was of Juda,

34.verse: that was of Jacob, that was of Isaac, that was of Abraham, that was of Thara, that was of Nachor,

35.verse: that was of Saruch, that was of Ragau, that was of Phalec, that was of Heber, that was of Sala,

36.verse: that was of Cainan, that was of Arphaxad, that was of Sem, that was of Noe, that was of Lamech,

37.verse: that was of Mathusala, that was of Enoch, that was of Jared, that was of Maleleel, that was of Cainan,

38.verse: that was of Enos, that was of Seth, that was of Adam, that was of God.

1.verse: And Jesus full of the Holy Ghost turned again from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into desert

2.verse: forty days, and was tempted of the devil, and [he] ate nothing in those days; and when those days were ended, he hungered.

3.verse: And the devil said to him, If thou art God's Son [If thou be God's Son], say to this stone, that it be made bread.

4.verse: And Jesus answered to him, It is written, That a man liveth not in bread alone, but in every word of God.

5.verse: And the devil led him into an high hill, and showed to him all the realms of the world in a moment of time;

6.verse: and said to him, I shall give to thee all this power, and the glory of them, for to me they be given, and to whom I will, I give them;

7.verse: therefore if thou fall down, and worship before me [therefore if thou shalt worship before me], all things shall be thine.

8.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to him, It is written, Thou shalt worship thy Lord God [Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God], and to him alone thou shalt serve.

9.verse: And he led him into Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, If thou art God's Son, send thyself from hence down;

10.verse: for it is written, For he hath commanded to his angels of thee, that they keep thee in all thy ways,

11.verse: and that they shall take thee in hands, lest peradventure thou hurt thy foot at a stone. [and for in hands they shall take thee, lest peradventure thou hurt thy foot on a stone.]

12.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt thy Lord God. [And Jesus answering saith to him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.]

13.verse: And when every temptation was ended, the fiend went away from him [the devil went away from him] for a time.

14.verse: And Jesus turned again in the virtue of the Spirit into Galilee, and the fame went forth of him through all the country.

15.verse: And he taught in the synagogues of them, and was magnified of all men.

16.verse: And he came to Nazareth, where he was nourished, and he entered after his custom in the sabbath day into a synagogue [into the synagogue], and rose to read.

17.verse: And the book of Esaias, the prophet, was taken to him; and as he turned the book, he found a place, where it was written,

18.verse: The Spirit of the Lord is on me, for which thing he anointed me; he sent me to preach to poor men, to heal contrite men in heart, and to preach remission to prisoners, and sight to blind men , and to deliver broken men into remission;

19.verse: to preach the year of the Lord pleasant, and the day of yielding again [to preach the year of the Lord accepted, or pleasant, and the day of retribution, or yielding again.]

20.verse: And when he had closed the book, he gave [it] again to the minister, and sat; and the eyes of all men in the synagogue were beholding into him.

21.verse: And he began to say to them, For in this day this scripture is fulfilled in your ears.

22.verse: And all men gave witnessing to him, and wondered in the words of grace, that came forth of his mouth [that came out of his mouth]. And they said, Whether this is not the son of Joseph?

23.verse: And he said to them, Soothly ye shall say to me this likeness, Physician, heal thyself. The Pharisees said to Jesus, How great things have we heard done in Capernaum, do thou also here in thy country. [And he said to them, Soothly ye shall say to me this likeness, Leech, heal thyself. How great things have we heard done in Capernaum, make thou and here in thy country.]

24.verse: And he said, Truly I say to you, that no prophet is received in his own country. [Soothly he saith, Truly I say to you, for no man prophet is accepted, or received, in his own country.]

25.verse: In truth I say to you, that many widows were in the days of Elias, the prophet, in Israel, when heaven was closed three years and six months, when great hunger was made in all the earth [when great hunger was made on all earth, or every land];

26.verse: and to none of them was Elias sent, but into Sarepta of Sidon, to a woman a widow.

27.verse: And many mesels were in Israel, under Eliseus, the prophet, and none of them was cleansed, but Naaman of Syria.

28.verse: And all in the synagogue hearing these things, were filled with wrath.

29.verse: And they rose up, and drove him out [and cast him out] without the city, and led him to the top of the hill on which their city was builded, to cast him down [that they should cast him down].

30.verse: But Jesus passed, and went through the middle of them; [Soothly Jesus passing went through the middle of them;]

31.verse: and he came down into Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and there he taught them in [the] sabbaths.

32.verse: And they were astonished in his teaching, for his word was in power.

33.verse: And in their synagogue was a man having an unclean fiend, and he cried with great voice, [And in the synagogue was a man having an unclean fiend, and cried with great voice,]

34.verse: and said [saying], Suffer, what to us and to thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us [to lose us]? I know thee, that thou art the holy of God.

35.verse: And Jesus blamed him, and said [saying], Wax dumb, and go out from him. And when the fiend had cast him forth into the middle, he went away from him, and he harmed him nothing.

36.verse: And dread was made in all men, and they spake together, and said [saying], What is this word, for in power and virtue he commandeth to unclean spirits, and they go out?

37.verse: And the fame was published of him into each place of the country.

38.verse: And Jesus rose up from the synagogue, and entered into the house of Simon [Forsooth Jesus rising of the synagogue, entered into the house of Simon]; and the mother of Simon's wife was holden with a great fevers, and they prayed him for her.

39.verse: And Jesus stood over her, and commanded to the fever, and it left her; and at once she rose up, and served them [and anon she rising ministered to them].

40.verse: And when the sun went down, all that had sick men with diverse languors, led them to him; and he set his hands on each by themselves, and healed them. [Forsooth when the sun went down, all that had sick men with diverse languishings, or aches, led them to him; and he, putting hands to each by himself, healed them.]

41.verse: And fiends went out from many, and cried, and said [crying, and saying], For thou art the Son of God. And he blamed, and suffered them not to speak [And he blaming suffered not them to speak], for they knew him, that he was Christ.

42.verse: And when the day was come, he went out, and went into a desert place; and the people sought him, and they came to him [and they came unto him], and they held him, that he should not go away from them.

43.verse: To whom he said, For also to other cities it behooveth me to preach the kingdom of God, for therefore I am sent [for thereto I am sent].

44.verse: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.

1.verse: And it was done, when the people came fast to Jesus, to hear the word of God, he stood beside the pool of Gennesaret [and he stood beside the standing water of Gennesaret],

2.verse: and saw two boats standing beside the pool; and the fishers were gone down, and washed their nets. [and saw two boats standing beside the standing water; soothly the fishers had gone down, and washed nets.]

3.verse: And he went up into a boat, that was Simon's, and prayed him to lead it a little from the land; and he sat, and taught the people out of the boat.

4.verse: And as he ceased to speak, he said to Simon, Lead out into the depth, and slack your nets to take fish [and slake ye your nets into the taking].

5.verse: And Simon answered, and said to him [And Simon answering said to him], Commander, we travailed all the night, and took nothing, but in thy word I shall lay out the net.

6.verse: And when they had done this thing, they closed together a great multitude of fishes; and their net was broken.

7.verse: And they beckoned to fellows, that were in another boat, that they should come, and help them. And they came, and filled both the boats, so that they were almost drowned.

8.verse: And when Simon Peter saw this thing, he felled down to the knees of Jesus, and said [saying], Lord, go from me, for I am a sinful man.

9.verse: For he was on each side astonished, and all that were with him, in the taking of fishes which they took.

10.verse: Soothly in like manner James and John, the sons of Zebedee, that were fellows of Simon Peter [which were fellows of Simon Peter]. And Jesus said to Simon, Do not thou dread; now from this time thou shalt take men.

11.verse: And when the boats were led up to the land, they left all things, and they followed him. [And the boats led up to the land, all things left, or forsaken, they followed him.]

12.verse: And it was done, when he was in one of the cities, lo! a man full of leprosy; and seeing Jesus fell down on his face, and prayed him, and said [saying], Lord, if thou wilt, thou mayest make me clean.

13.verse: And Jesus held forth his hand, and touched him, and said [saying], I will, be thou made clean. And at once [And anon] the leprosy passed away from him.

14.verse: And Jesus commanded to him, that he should say to no man; But go, show thee to a priest, and offer for thy cleansing, as Moses bade, into witnessing to them.

15.verse: And the word walked about the more of him; and much people [and many companies] came together, to hear, and to be healed of their sicknesses.

16.verse: And he went into desert, and prayed.

17.verse: And it was done in one of the days, he sat, and taught [and he sitting taught]; and there were Pharisees sitting, and doctors of the law, that came of each castle of Galilee, and of Judaea, and of Jerusalem ; and the virtue of the Lord was to heal sick men.

18.verse: And lo! men bare in a bed a man that was sick in the palsy [that was sick in palsy], and they sought to bear him in, and set before him [and to put before him].

19.verse: And they found not in what part they should bear him in, for the people, and they went upon the roof [And they not finding in what part they should bear him in, for the company of people, ascended up on the roof], and by the slates they let him down with the bed, into the midst, before Jesus.

20.verse: And when Jesus saw the faith of them, he said, Man, thy sins be forgiven to thee.

21.verse: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to think, saying, Who is this, that speaketh blasphemies? who may forgive sins, but God alone?

22.verse: And as Jesus knew the thoughts of them, he answered, and said to them [he answering said to them], What think ye evil things in your hearts?

23.verse: What is lighter to say, Sins be forgiven to thee, or to say, Rise up, and walk?

24.verse: But that ye know, that man's Son hath power in earth to forgive sins, he said to the sick man in palsy, I say to thee, rise up, take thy bed, and go into thine house.

25.verse: And at once [And anon] he rose up before them, and took the bed in which he lay, and went into his house, and magnified God [magnifying God].

26.verse: And great wonder took all, and they magnified God; and they were full-filled with great dread, and said , For we have seen marvelous things to day.

27.verse: And after these things Jesus went out, and saw a publican, Levi by name, sitting at the tollbooth. And he said to him, Follow thou me;

28.verse: and when he had left all things, he rose up, and followed him.

29.verse: And Levi made to him a great feast in his house; and there was a great company of publicans, and of others that were with them, sitting at the meat.

30.verse: And the Pharisees and the scribes of them grumbled, and said to his disciples [And Pharisees and the scribes of them grutched, saying to his disciples], Why eat ye and drink with publicans and sinful men?

31.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them, They that be whole have no need to a physician, but they that be sick; [And Jesus answering saith to them, They that be whole have not need to a leech, but they that have evil;]

32.verse: for I came not to call just men, but sinful men to penance.

33.verse: And they said to him, Why the disciples of John fast oft, and make prayers, also and of the Pharisees, but thine eat and drink?

34.verse: To whom he said, Whether ye be able to make the sons of the spouse to fast [Whether ye may make the sons of the spouse to fast], while the spouse is with them?

35.verse: But days shall come, when the spouse shall be taken away from them, and then they shall fast in those days.

36.verse: And he said to them also a likeness; For no man taketh a piece from a new cloak [of a new cloth], and putteth it into an old clothing [and putteth it into an old cloth]; else both he breaketh the new, and the piece of the new accordeth not to the old.

37.verse: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles; else the new wine shall break the bottles, and the wine shall be shed out, and the bottles shall perish.

38.verse: But new wine oweth to be put into new bottles [But new wine is to be put into new wine vessels], and both be kept.

39.verse: And no man drinking the old, will at once the new; for he saith, The old is the better. [And no man drinking old, will anon new; soothly he saith, The old is better.]

1.verse: And it was done in the second first sabbath [in the first second sabbath], when he passed by the corns, his disciples plucked ears of corn; and they rubbing with their hands, ate.

2.verse: And some of the Pharisees said to them, What do ye that, that is not leaveful in the sabbaths?

3.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them [And Jesus answering said to them], Have ye not read, what David did, when he hungered, and they that were with him;

4.verse: how he entered into the house of God, and took loaves of proposition, and ate, and gave to them that were with him; which loaves it was not leaveful to eat, but only to priests .

5.verse: And he said to them, For man's Son is Lord, yea, of the sabbath.

6.verse: And it was done [and] in another sabbath, that he entered into a synagogue, and taught. And a man was there, and his right hand was dry.

7.verse: And the scribes and the Pharisees espied him [Forsooth scribes and Pharisees espied him], if he would heal him in the sabbath, that they should find cause, whereof they should accuse him.

8.verse: And he knew the thoughts of them, and he said to the man that had a dry hand, Rise up, and stand in the middle. And he rose, and stood.

9.verse: And Jesus said to them, I ask you, if it is leaveful to do well in the sabbath [day], or evil? to make a soul safe, or to destroy [or to lose]?

10.verse: And when he had beheld all men about [And, all men looked about], he said to the man, Hold forth thine hand. And he held forth, and his hand was restored to health.

11.verse: And they were full-filled with unwisdom , and spake together, what they should do of Jesus.

12.verse: And it was done in those days, he went out into an hill to pray; and he was all night dwelling in the prayer of God.

13.verse: And when the day was come, he called his disciples, and chose twelve of them, which he called also apostles [whom and apostles he named];

14.verse: Simon, whom he called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

15.verse: Matthew and Thomas, James Alphaeus, and Simon, that is called Zelotes,

16.verse: Judas of James, and Judas Iscariot, that was traitor.

17.verse: And Jesus came down from the hill with them, and stood in a field place; and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of [poor] people, of all Judaea, and Jerusalem, and of the sea coasts, and of Tyre and Sidon, that came to hear him [which came, that they should hear him], and to be healed of their sicknesses;

18.verse: and they that were travailed of unclean spirits, were healed. [and they that were travailed with unclean spirits, were healed.]

19.verse: And all the people [And each company of the people] sought to touch him, for virtue went out of him, and healed all.

20.verse: And when his eyes were cast up into his disciples, he said, Blessed be ye, poor men [Blessed ye, poor], for the kingdom of God is yours.

21.verse: Blessed be ye, that now hunger, for ye shall be full-filled. Blessed be ye, that now weep, for ye shall laugh. [Blessed be ye that hunger now, for ye shall be filled. Blessed be ye that weep now, for ye shall laugh.]

22.verse: Ye shall be blessed, when men shall hate you, and [shall] separate you away, and [shall] put reproof to you [and shall put shame on you], and cast out your name as evil, for man's Son.

23.verse: Joy ye in that day, and be ye glad; for lo! your meed is much in heaven; for after these things the fathers of them did to prophets.

24.verse: Nevertheless woe to you, rich men, that have your comfort.

25.verse: Woe to you that be full-filled [Woe to you that be filled], for ye shall hunger. Woe to you that now laugh [Woe to you that laugh now], for ye shall mourn, and weep.

26.verse: Woe to you, when all men shall bless you; after these things the fathers of them did to [false] prophets.

27.verse: But I say to you that hear, love ye your enemies, do ye well to them that hated you [do ye well to them that hate you];

28.verse: bless ye men that curse you, pray ye for men that defame you [pray ye for men that falsely challenge you].

29.verse: And to him that smiteth thee on the one cheek, show also the other [give also the other]; and from him that taketh away from thee a cloak [thy cloth], do not thou forbid the coat.

30.verse: And give to each that asketh thee, and if a man taketh away those things that be thine [and he that taketh away those things that be thine], ask thou not again.

31.verse: And as ye will that men do to you, do ye also to them in like manner.

32.verse: And if ye love them that love you, what thank is to you [what grace, or thank, is to you]? for sinful men love men that love them.

33.verse: And if ye do well to them that do well to you, what grace is to you ? for sinful men do this thing.

34.verse: And if ye lend to them of which ye hope to take again, what thank is to you [And if ye give borrowing, or lend, to them, of whom ye hope for to take again, what grace, or thank, is to you]? for sinful men lend to sinful men, to take again as much.

35.verse: Nevertheless love ye your enemies, and do ye well, and lend ye, hoping nothing thereof, and your meed shall be much, and ye shall be the sons of the Highest, for he is benign on [upon] unkind men and evil men.

36.verse: Therefore be ye merciful, as [and] your Father is merciful.

37.verse: Do not ye deem, and ye shall not be deemed. Do not ye condemn, and ye shall not be condemned; forgive ye, and it shall be forgiven to you.

38.verse: Give ye, and it shall be given to you. They shall give into your bosom a good measure, and well-filled, and shaken together, and overflowing; for by the same measure, by which ye mete, it shall be meted again to you.

39.verse: And he said to them a likeness, Whether the blind may lead the blind? nor fall they not both into the ditch [whether they fall not both into the ditch]?

40.verse: A disciple is not above his master; but each shall be perfect, if he [shall] be as his master.

41.verse: And what seest thou in thy brother's eye a mote, but thou beholdest not a beam, that is in thine own eye?

42.verse: Or how mayest thou say to thy brother, Brother, suffer, I shall cast out the mote of thine eye, and thou beholdest not a beam that is in thine own eye? Hypocrite, first take out the beam of thine eye [first cast out the beam of thine eye], and then thou shalt see to take out the mote of thy brother's eye.

43.verse: It is not a good tree [Forsooth it is not a good tree], that maketh evil fruits, neither an evil tree, that maketh good fruits;

44.verse: for every tree is known of his fruit. And men gather not figs of thorns, neither men gather a grape of a bush of briers.

45.verse: A good man of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth good things, and an evil man of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things [A good man of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth good thing, and an evil man of evil treasure bringeth forth evil thing]; for of the plenty of the heart the mouth speaketh.

46.verse: And what call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not those things that I say.

47.verse: Each that cometh to me, and heareth my words, and doeth them, I shall show to you, to whom he is like.

48.verse: He is like to a man that buildeth an house, that digged deep, and set the foundament on a stone. And when a great flood was made, the flood was hurled to that house, and it might not move it, for it was founded on a firm stone.

49.verse: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like to a man building his house on earth [upon the earth] without foundament; into which the flood was hurled, and at once it fell down [into which the flood was hurtled, and anon it felled down]; and the falling down of that house was made great.

1.verse: And when he had fulfilled all his words into the ears of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

2.verse: But a servant of a centurion, that was precious to him, was sick, and drawing to the death. [Soothly a servant of some man centurion, having evil, was to die, the which was precious to him.]

3.verse: And when he had heard of Jesus, he sent to him the elder men of Jews, and prayed him [praying him], that he would come, and heal his servant.

4.verse: And when they came to Jesus, they prayed him busily, and said to him, For he is worthy, that thou grant to him this thing; [And, when they came to Jesus, they prayed busily, saying to him, For he is worthy that thou give to him this thing;]

5.verse: for he loveth our folk, and he builded to us a synagogue. [for he loveth our folk, and he built to us a synagogue.]

6.verse: And Jesus went with them. And when he was not far from the house, the centurion sent to him friends, and said [saying], Lord, do not thou be travailed, for I am not worthy, that thou enter under my roof;

7.verse: for which thing I deemed not myself worthy, that I come to thee; but say thou by word, and my child shall be healed.

8.verse: For I am a man ordained under power, and have knights under me [having under me knights]; and I say to this, Go, and he goeth, and to another, Come, and he cometh, and to my servant, Do this thing, and he doeth [it].

9.verse: And when this thing was heard, Jesus wondered; [and he turned,] and said to the people following him, Truly I say to you, neither in Israel I found so great faith [not in Israel I found so great faith].

10.verse: And they that were sent, turned again home, and found the servant whole [found the servant whole], that was sick.

11.verse: And it was done afterward, Jesus went into a city, that is called Nain, and his disciples; and full great people went with him.

12.verse: And when he came nigh to the gate of the city, lo! the son of a woman that had no more children, was borne out dead [lo! an only son of his mother was borne out dead]; and this was a widow; and much people of the city [was] with her.

13.verse: And when the Lord Jesus had seen her, he had ruth on her, and said to her, Do not thou weep.

14.verse: And he came nigh, and touched the bier [And he came, and touched the bier]; and they that bare the bier stood. And he said, Young man, I say to thee, rise up.

15.verse: And he that was dead sat up again, and began to speak [And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak]; and he gave him to his mother.

16.verse: And dread took all men, and they magnified God, and said [saying], For a great prophet is risen among us, and, For God hath visited his people.

17.verse: And this word went out of him into all Judaea, and into all the country about.

18.verse: And John's disciples told him of all these things. [And the disciples of John told to him of all these things.]

19.verse: And John called twain of his disciples, and sent them to Jesus, and said [And John called together two of his disciples, and sent to Jesus, saying], Art thou he that is to come, or abide we another?

20.verse: And when the men came to him [Soothly when the men had come to him], they said, John Baptist sent us to thee, and said [saying], Art thou he that is to come, or we abide another?

21.verse: And in that hour he healed many men of their sicknesses, and wounds, and [of] evil spirits; and he gave sight to many blind men.

22.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them [And Jesus answering said to them], Go ye again, and tell ye to John those things that ye have heard and seen; blind men see, crooked men go, mesels be made clean, deaf men hear, dead men rise again, poor men be taken to preaching of the gospel.

23.verse: And he that shall not be caused to stumble in me [And whoever shall not be offended in me], is blessed.

24.verse: And when the messengers of John were gone forth [And when the messengers of John had gone away], he began to say of John to the people, What went ye out into desert to see? a reed wagged with the wind [a reed waved with the wind]?

25.verse: But what went ye out to see? a man clothed with soft clothes? Lo! they that be in [a] precious cloak [Lo! they that be in precious cloth] and in delights, be in kings' houses.

26.verse: But what went ye out to see? a prophet? Yea, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

27.verse: This is he, of whom it is written, Lo! I send mine angel before thy face, which shall make ready thy way before thee.

28.verse: Certainly I say to you, there is no man a more prophet among the children of women, than is John Baptist [Soothly I say to you, among the children of women, no man is more prophet than John Baptist]; but he that is less in the kingdom of heavens, is more than he.

29.verse: And all the people hearing, and publicans, that had been baptized with the baptism of John, justified God; [And all the people hearing, and publicans, baptized with the baptism of John, justified God;]

30.verse: but the Pharisees and the wise men of the law, that were not baptized of him [forsooth Pharisees and wise men of law, not baptized of him], despised the counsel of God against themselves.

31.verse: And the Lord said, Therefore to whom shall I say men of this generation like, and to whom be they like?

32.verse: They be like to children [They be like children] sitting in the market, and speaking together, and saying, We have sung to you with pipes, and ye have not danced; we have made mourning [we have made lamentation, or mourning], and ye have not wept.

33.verse: For John Baptist came, neither eating bread, nor drinking wine, and ye say, He hath a fiend.

34.verse: Man's Son came eating and drinking, and ye say, Lo! a man a devourer [Lo! a man (a) devourer, or glutton], and drinking wine, a friend of publicans and of sinful men.

35.verse: And wisdom is justified of [all] her sons.

36.verse: But one of the Pharisees prayed Jesus, that he should eat with him. And he entered into the house of the Pharisee, and sat at the meat.

37.verse: And lo! a sinful woman, that was in the city, as she knew, that Jesus sat at meat in the house of the Pharisee, she brought an alabaster box of ointment; [And lo! a woman sinner, that was in the city, as she knew, that Jesus had sat at the meat in the house of the Pharisee, brought an alabaster box of ointment;]

38.verse: and she stood behind beside his feet, and began to moist his feet with tears [and standing behind beside his feet, began to moist his feet with tears], and wiped [them] with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed with ointment.

39.verse: And the Pharisee seeing, that had called him, said within himself, saying, If this were a prophet, he should know, who and what manner woman it were that toucheth him, for she is a sinful woman. [Soothly the Pharisee seeing, that called him, saith within himself, saying, If this were a prophet, soothly he should know, who and what manner woman it is that toucheth him, for she is a sinner.]

40.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to him, Simon, I have something to say to thee. And he said, Master, say thou. [And Jesus answering said to him, Simon, I have something to say to thee. And he saith, Master, say thou.]

41.verse: And he answered, Two debtors were to one lender; and one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty; [And he answered, Two debtors were to some lender, or usurer; one owed five hundred pence, and an other fifty;]

42.verse: but when they had not whereof to yield, he forgave [freely] to both. Who then loveth him more? [soothly them not having whereof they should yield, he forgave freely to both. Who of them therefore loveth him more?]

43.verse: Simon answered, and said, I guess, that he to whom he forgave more. And he answered to him, Thou hast deemed rightly.

44.verse: And he turned to the woman, and said to Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, thou gavest no water to my feet; but this hath moisted my feet with tears [forsooth this woman hath moisted my feet with tears], and wiped with her hairs.

45.verse: Thou hast not given to me a kiss; but this, since she entered, ceased not to kiss my feet.

46.verse: Thou anointedest not mine head with oil [Thou hast not anointed mine head with oil]; but this anointed my feet with ointment.

47.verse: For which thing I say to thee, many sins be forgiven to her, for she hath loved much [for she loved much]; and to whom is less forgiven, he loveth less.

48.verse: And Jesus said to her, Thy sins be forgiven to thee.

49.verse: And they that sat together at the meat, began to say within themselves, Who is this that [also] forgiveth sins.

50.verse: But he said to the woman, Thy faith hath made thee safe; go thou in peace.

1.verse: And it was done afterward, and Jesus made journey by cities and castles, preaching and evangelizing the realm of God, and twelve with him;

2.verse: and some women that were healed of wicked spirits and sicknesses, Mary, that is called Magdalene, of whom seven devils went out,

3.verse: and Joanna, the wife of Chuza, the procurator of Herod, and Susanna, and many others, that ministered to him of their riches [which ministered to him of their faculties, or riches].

4.verse: And when much people was come together, and men hied to him from the cities, he said by a similitude, [Forsooth when full much company came together, and from cities hasted to him, he said by a likeness, or example,]

5.verse: He that soweth, went out to sow his seed. And while he soweth, some fell beside the way, and was defouled, and birds of the air ate it.

6.verse: And other fell on a stone, and it sprang up, and dried, for it had not moisture [for it had no moisture].

7.verse: And other fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up together, and strangled it.

8.verse: And other fell into good earth [And another fell down into good land], and it sprang up, and made an hundredfold fruit. He said these things, and cried, He that hath ears of hearing, hear he.

9.verse: But his disciples asked him, what this parable was.

10.verse: And he said to them, To you it is granted to know the private of the kingdom of God [To you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God]; but to other men in parables, that they seeing see not, and they hearing understand not.

11.verse: And this is the parable. The seed is God's word;

12.verse: and they that be beside the way, be these that hear; and afterward the fiend cometh, and taketh away the word from their heart, lest they believing be made safe.

13.verse: But they that fell on a stone, be these that when they have heard [be these men which when they have heard], receive the word with joy. And these have no roots [And these have not root]; for at a time they believe, and in time of temptation they go away.

14.verse: But that that fell among thorns, be these that heard, and of busynesses, and riches, and lusts of life [and volupties of life] they go forth, and be strangled, and bring forth no fruit.

15.verse: But that that fell into good earth, be these that, in a good heart, and best, hear the word, and hold, and bring forth fruit in patience. [Forsooth that that fell into good earth, be these which, in good heart and best, hearing the word hold, and bring forth fruit in patience.]

16.verse: No man lighteth a lantern, and covereth it with a vessel [Forsooth no man lighting a lantern, covereth it with a vessel], or putteth it under a bed, but on a candlestick, that men that enter see light.

17.verse: For there is no privy thing, which shall not be opened, neither hid thing, which shall not be known, and come into open.

18.verse: Therefore see ye, how ye hear; for it shall be given to him that hath, and whoever hath not, also that that he weeneth that he have , shall be taken away from him.

19.verse: And his mother and brethren came to him; and they might not come to him for the people [and they might not go fully to him for the company of people].

20.verse: And it was told to him, Thy mother and thy brethren stand withoutforth, willing to see thee.

21.verse: And he answered, and said to them, My mother and my brethren be these, that hear the word of God [which hear the word of God], and do it.

22.verse: And it was done in one of the days, he went up into a boat, and his disciples. And he said to them, Pass we over the sea [Pass we over the standing water]. And they went up.

23.verse: And while they rowed, he slept. And a tempest of wind came down into the water, and they were driven hither and thither with waves, and were in peril.

24.verse: And they came nigh, and raised him, and said [saying], Commander, we perish. And he rose up, and blamed the wind, and the tempest of the water; and it ceased, and peaceability was made.

25.verse: And he said to them, Where is your faith? Which dreading wondered, and said together [saying together], Who, guessest thou, is this? for he commandeth to the winds and to the sea, and they obey to him.

26.verse: And they rowed to the country of Gadarenes, that is against Galilee [which is against Galilee].

27.verse: And when he went out to the land, a man ran to him, that had a devil long time, and he was not clothed with cloak , neither dwelled in house, but in sepulchres.

28.verse: This, when he saw Jesus, fell down before him, and he crying with a great voice said, What to me and to thee, Jesus, the Son of the highest God [This as he saw Jesus, felled down before him, and crying with great voice said, What to me and to thee, Jesus, the Son of God the highest]? I beseech thee, that thou torment me not.

29.verse: For he commanded the unclean spirit, that he should go out from the man. For he took him oft times, and he was bound with chains, and kept in stocks, and when the bonds were broken [and, the bonds broken], he was led of the devil into desert.

30.verse: And Jesus asked him, and said [saying], What name is to thee? And he said, A legion; for many devils were entered into him.

31.verse: And they prayed him, that he should not command them, that they should go into hell [that they should go into the deepness].

32.verse: And there was a flock of many swine pasturing in an hill, and they prayed him, that he should suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.

33.verse: And so the devils went out from the man, and entered into the swine; and with a rush the flock went headlong into the pool, and was drowned [and with rush the flock went headlong into the lake of water, and was strangled].

34.verse: And when the herders saw this thing done [The which thing, as they that pastured, or kept in pastures, saw done], they fled, and told into the city, and into the towns.

35.verse: And they went out to see that thing that was done. And they came to Jesus, and they found the man sitting clothed, from whom the devils went out, and in whole mind at his feet; and they dreaded.

36.verse: And they that saw told to them, how he was made whole of the legion.

37.verse: And all the multitude of the country of Gadarenes prayed him, that he should go from them, for they were held with great dread [for they were holden with great dread]. And he went up into a boat, and turned again.

38.verse: And the man of whom the devils were gone out [And the man of whom the devils went out], prayed him, that he should be with him. Jesus let him go, and said [Soothly Jesus left him, saying],

39.verse: Go again into thine house, and tell how great things God hath done to thee. And he went through all the city, and preached, how great things Jesus had done to him.

40.verse: And it was done, when Jesus was gone again, the people received him; for all were abiding him.

41.verse: And lo! a man, to whom the name was Jairus, and he was [a] prince of a synagogue; and he fell down at the feet of Jesus, and prayed him, that he should enter into his house,

42.verse: for he had but one [only] daughter, almost of twelve years old, and she was dead [and this died]. And it befell, the while he went [while he went], he was thronged of the people.

43.verse: And a woman that had a flux of blood twelve years, and had spended all her chattel in physicians, and might not be cured of any,

44.verse: and she came nigh behind, and touched the hem of his cloak, and at once the flux of her blood ceased. [came nigh behind, and touched the hem of his cloth, and anon the flux of her blood ceased.]

45.verse: And Jesus said, Who is it that touched me? And when all men denied, Peter said, and they that were with him, Commander, the people thrust, and dis-ease thee [Commander, companies of people throng and torment thee], and thou sayest, Who touched me?

46.verse: And Jesus said, Some man hath touched me, for that virtue went out of me [for why and I have known virtue to have gone out of me].

47.verse: And the woman seeing, that it was not hid from him, [she] came trembling, and fell down at his feet, and for what cause she had touched him she showed before all the people, and how at once she was healed.

48.verse: And he said to her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee safe; go thou in peace [go in peace].

49.verse: And yet while he spake, a man came from the prince of the synagogue, and said to him [Yet him speaking, some man came to the prince of the synagogue, saying to him], Thy daughter is dead, do not thou travail the master.

50.verse: And when this word was heard, Jesus answered to the father of the damsel, Do not thou dread, but believe thou only [but only believe thou], and she shall be safe.

51.verse: And when he came to the house, he suffered no man to enter with him, but Peter and John and James, and the father and the mother of the damsel.

52.verse: And all wept, and bewailed her. And he said, Do not ye weep, for the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.

53.verse: And they scorned him, and knew that she was dead. [And they scorned him, witting that she was dead.]

54.verse: But he held her hand, and cried, and said [saying], Damsel, rise up.

55.verse: And her spirit turned again, and she rose at once [and she rose anon]. And he commanded to give to her to eat [And he commanded to give to her for to eat].

56.verse: And her father and mother wondered greatly; and he commanded them, that they should not say to any [man] that thing that was done. [And her father and mother wondered greatly; to whom he commanded, that they should not say to any man that that was done.]

1.verse: And when the twelve apostles were called together, Jesus gave to them virtue and power on [upon] all devils, and that they should heal sicknesses.

2.verse: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal sick men.

3.verse: And he said to them, Nothing take ye in the way, neither a staff, nor scrip, neither bread, nor money , and neither have ye two coats.

4.verse: And into what house ye enter, dwell ye there, and go ye not out from thence. [And into whatever house ye shall enter, dwell ye there, and go ye not out thence.]

5.verse: And whoever receive not you, go ye out of that city, and shake ye off the powder of your feet into witnessing on them. [And whoever shall not receive you, ye going out of that city shake off also the powder of your feet into witnessing upon them.]

6.verse: And they went forth, and went about by castles, preaching [evangelizing] and healing every where.

7.verse: And Herod [the] tetrarch heard all [the] things that were done of him, and he doubted, for that it was said of some men, that John was risen from death;

8.verse: and of some men, that Elias had appeared; but of others, that one of the old prophets was risen.

9.verse: And Herod said, I have beheaded John; and who is this, of whom I hear such things? And he sought to see him.

10.verse: And the apostles turned again, and told to him all things that they had done. And he took them, and went beside into a desert place, that is Bethsaida [the which is called Bethsaida].

11.verse: And when the people knew this, they followed him. And he received them, and spake to them of the kingdom of God; and he healed them that had need of cure [and healed them that had need of cure].

12.verse: And the day began to bow down, and the twelve came, and said to him, Let go the people [Leave the companies of people], that they go, and turn into the castles and towns, that be about, that they find meat [that they find meats], for we be here in a desert place.

13.verse: And he said to them, Give ye to them to eat. And they said, There be not to us more than five loaves and two fishes, but peradventure that we go, and buy meats to all this people [and buy meats for all the company].

14.verse: And the men were almost five thousand. And he said to his disciples, Make them sit to meat by companies, a fifty together.

15.verse: And they did so, and they made all men sit to [the] meat.

16.verse: And when he had taken the five loaves and two fishes, he beheld into heaven, and blessed them, and brake, and dealed to his disciples, that they should set before the companies.

17.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

18.verse: And it was done, when he was alone praying, his disciples were with him, and he asked them, and said [saying], Whom say the people that I am?

19.verse: And they answered, and said, John Baptist, others say Elias, and others say, one prophet of the former is risen [but others say, for one prophet of the former hath risen].

20.verse: And he said to them, But whom say ye that I am? Simon Peter answered, and said, The Christ of God [Simon Peter answering said, The Christ of God].

21.verse: And he blaming them commanded that they should say to no man, [And he blaming them commanded them that they should say to no man these things,]

22.verse: and said these things [saying], For it behooveth man's Son to suffer many things, and to be reproved of the elder men, and of the princes of priests [and princes of priests], and of the scribes, and to be slain, and the third day to rise again.

23.verse: And he said to all [men], If any [man] will come after me, deny he himself, and take he his cross every day [and take his cross every day], and follow he me.

24.verse: For he that will make his life safe shall lose it; and he that loseth his life for me, shall make it safe. [Soothly he that shall desire to make his life safe, shall lose it; for why he that shall lose his life for me, shall make it safe.]

25.verse: And what profiteth a man, if he win all the world, and lose himself, and do impairing of himself. [Forsooth what profiteth it to a man, if he win all the world, forsooth lose himself, and do impairing to himself.]

26.verse: For who so shameth me and my words, man's Son shall shame him, when he cometh in his majesty [For why who that shall shame me and my words, and man's Son shall shame him, when he shall come in his majesty], and of the Father's, and of the holy angels.

27.verse: And I say to you, verily there be some standing here, which shall not taste death, till they see the realm of God.

28.verse: And it was done after these words almost eight days, and he took Peter and James and John, and he ascended into an hill, to pray.

29.verse: And while he prayed, the likeness of his face was changed, and his clothing was white shining. [And the while he prayed, the likeness of his cheer was made other manner, and his clothing white shining.]

30.verse: And lo! two men spake with him, and Moses and Elias

31.verse: were seen in majesty; and they said his going out, which he should fulfill in Jerusalem.

32.verse: And Peter, and they that were with him, were heavy of sleep [were grieved, or heavied, with sleep], and they waking saw his majesty, and the two men that stood with him.

33.verse: And it was done, when they departed from him, Peter said to Jesus, Commander, it is good that we be here, and make we here three tabernacles, one to thee, and one to Moses, and one to Elias. And he knew not what he should say. [And it was done, when they departed from him, Peter saith to Jesus, Commander, it is good to us for to be here, and make we here three tabernacles, one to thee, and one to Moses, and one to Elias; not witting what he should say.]

34.verse: But while he spake these things, a cloud was made, and overshadowed them; and they dreaded, when they entered into the cloud.

35.verse: And a voice was made out of the cloud, and said [saying], This is my dear-worthy Son, hear ye him.

36.verse: And while the voice was made, Jesus was found alone. And they were still, and to no man said in those days any of those things, that they had seen [And they held peace, and said to no man in those days aught of those things, which they had seen].

37.verse: But it was done in the day following, when they came down of the hill, much people met them.

38.verse: And lo! a man of the company cried, and said [saying], Master, I beseech thee, behold [into] my son, for I have no more [for he is only to me];

39.verse: and lo! a spirit taketh him, and suddenly he crieth, and hurtleth [him] down, and draweth him with foam, and scarcely he goeth away drawing him all to pieces.

40.verse: And I prayed thy disciples, that they should cast him out, and they might not.

41.verse: And Jesus answered and said to them, A! unfaithful generation and wayward [Soothly Jesus answering said to them, O! unfaithful generation and wayward], how long shall I be with you, and suffer you? bring hither thy son.

42.verse: And when he came nigh, the devil hurtled him down [the devil hurled him down], and wrenched him. And Jesus blamed the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and yielded him to his father.

43.verse: And all men wondered greatly in the greatness of God. And when all men wondered in all things that he did [And all men wondering in all things which he did], he said to his disciples,

44.verse: Put ye these words in your hearts [Put ye these words in your heart], for it is to come, that man's Son be betrayed into the hands of men.

45.verse: And they knew not this word, and it was hid before them, that they feeled it not; and they dreaded to ask him of this word.

46.verse: But a thought entered into them, who of them should be greatest.

47.verse: And Jesus, seeing the thoughts of the heart of them, took a child, and setted [set] him beside him;

48.verse: and said to them, Whoever receiveth this child in my name, receiveth me; and whoever receiveth me, receiveth him that sent me; for he that is least among you all, is the greatest. [and said to them, Whoever shall receive this child in my name, receiveth me; and whoever shall receive me, receiveth him that sent me; for why he that is less among you all, this is the more.]

49.verse: And John answered and said, Commander, we saw a man casting out fiends in thy name, and we have forbidden him, for he followeth not thee with us.

50.verse: And Jesus said to him, Do not ye forbid, for he that is not against us, is for us.

51.verse: And it was done, when the days of his taking up were fulfilled, he set fast his face, to go to Jerusalem,

52.verse: and sent messengers before his sight. And they went, and entered into a city of Samaritans, to make ready to him.

53.verse: And they received not him, for the face of him was going into Jerusalem [for the face was of him going into Jerusalem].

54.verse: And when James and John, his disciples, saw, they said, Lord, wilt thou that we say [wilt thou that we ask], that fire come down from heaven, and waste them, [as Elias did]?

55.verse: And he turned, and blamed them, and said, Ye know not, whose spirits ye be; [And he turned blamed them, saying, Ye know not, whose spirit ye be;]

56.verse: for man's Son came not to destroy men's souls [to lose men's souls], but to save [them]. And they went into another castle.

57.verse: And it was done, when they walked in the way, a man said to him [some man said to him], I shall follow thee, whither ever thou [shalt] go.

58.verse: And Jesus said to him, Foxes have dens [Foxes have ditches, or dens], and birds of the air have nests, but man's Son hath not where he [shall] rest his head.

59.verse: And he said to another, Follow thou me. And he said, Lord, suffer me first to go, and bury my father.

60.verse: And Jesus said to him, Suffer that dead men bury their dead men [Suffer that dead men bury their dead]; but go thou, and tell the kingdom of God.

61.verse: And another said, Lord, I shall follow thee, but first suffer me to leave all things that be at home [but first suffer me to tell to them that be at home].

62.verse: And Jesus said to him, No man that putteth his hand to the plow, and beholding backward, is able to the kingdom of God.

1.verse: And after these things the Lord Jesus ordained also other seventy and twain, and sent them by twain and twain before his face into every city and place , whither he was to come.

2.verse: And he said to them, There is much ripe corn, and few workmen [Soothly much ripe corn is, but few workmen be]; therefore pray ye the Lord of the ripe corn, that he send workmen into his ripe corn.

3.verse: Go ye, lo! I send you as lambs among wolves.

4.verse: Therefore do not ye bear a satchel, neither scrip [Do not ye bear a satchel, nor scrip], neither shoes, and greet ye no man by the way.

5.verse: Into what house that ye enter [And into whatever house ye shall enter], first say ye, Peace to this house.

6.verse: And if a son of peace be there, your peace shall rest on him; but if none [if none], it shall turn again to you.

7.verse: And dwell ye in the same house [Forsooth in the same house dwell ye], eating and drinking those things that be at them; for a workman is worthy his hire. Do not ye pass from house into house.

8.verse: And into whatever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat ye those things that be set to you;

9.verse: and heal ye the sick men that be in that city. And say ye to them, The kingdom of God shall approach into you.

10.verse: And into what city ye enter [Into whatever city ye shall enter], and they receive you not, go ye out into the streets of it, and say ye,

11.verse: We wipe off against you the powder that cleaved to us of your city; nevertheless know ye this thing, that the realm of God shall come nigh.

12.verse: [Forsooth] I say to you, that to Sodom it shall be easier [for to Sodom, it shall be easier, or less pain,] than to that city in that day.

13.verse: Woe to thee, Chorazin; woe to thee, Bethsaida; for if in Tyre and Sidon the works of power [the virtues] had been done, which have been done in you, sometime they would have sat in haircloth and ashes, and have done penance [sometime they sitting in haircloth and ashes, should have done penance].

14.verse: Nevertheless to Tyre and Sidon it shall be easier in the doom than to you.

15.verse: And thou, Capernaum, art enhanced till to heaven; thou shalt be drowned till into hell [thou shalt be drowned down into hell].

16.verse: He that heareth you, heareth me; and he that despiseth you, despiseth me; and he that despiseth me, despiseth him that sent me.

17.verse: And the two and seventy disciples turned again with joy, and said [saying], Lord, also devils be subject to us in thy name.

18.verse: And he said to them, I saw Satan falling down from heaven, as lightning.

19.verse: And lo! I have given to you power to tread on serpents, and scorpions, and on [upon] all the virtue of the enemy, and nothing shall harm you.

20.verse: Nevertheless do not ye [have] joy in this thing, that spirits be subject to you; but joy ye, that your names be written in heavens.

21.verse: In that hour he gladded in the Holy Ghost, and said, I acknowledge to thee, Father, Lord of heaven and of earth, for thou hast hid these things from wise men and prudent, and hast showed them to small children. Yea, Father, for so it pleased before thee.

22.verse: All things be given to me of my Father, and no man knoweth, who is the Son, but the Father; and who is the Father, but the Son, and to whom the Son will show.

23.verse: And he turned to his disciples, and said, Blessed be the eyes, that see those things that ye see [Blessed be the eyes, which see those things that ye see].

24.verse: For I say to you, that many prophets and kings would have seen those things, that ye see [which ye see], and they saw not; and hear those things, that ye hear, and they heard not.

25.verse: And lo! a wise man of the law rose up, tempting him, and saying, Master, what thing shall I do to have everlasting life? [And lo! a wise man of law rose, tempting him, and saying, Master, what thing doing shall I wield everlasting life?]

26.verse: And he said to him, What is written in the law? how readest thou?

27.verse: He answered, and said, Thou shalt love thy Lord God [He answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God] of all thine heart, and of all thy soul, and of all thy strengths, and of all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.

28.verse: And Jesus said to him, Thou hast answered rightly; do this thing, and thou shalt live.

29.verse: But he willing to justify himself, said to Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

30.verse: And Jesus beheld, and said, A man came down from Jerusalem into Jericho, and fell among thieves, and they robbed him , and wounded him, and went away, and left the man half alive.

31.verse: And it befell, that a priest came down the same way, and passed forth, when he had seen him. [Forsooth it befell, that some priest came down in the same way, and, him seen, he passed forth.]

32.verse: Also [and] a deacon, when he was beside the place, and saw him, passed forth.

33.verse: But a Samaritan, going the way [Forsooth some Samaritan, making journey], came beside him; and he saw him, and had ruth on him;

34.verse: and came to him, and bound together his wounds, and poured in oil and wine [pouring in oil and wine]; and laid him on his beast, and led him into an hostelry, and did the care of him.

35.verse: And another day he brought forth two pence, and gave to the hosteler, and said, Have the care of him; and whatever thou shalt give over, I shall yield to thee, when I come again.

36.verse: Who of these three, seemeth to thee, was neighbour to him, that fell among [the] thieves?

37.verse: And he said, He that did mercy into him. And Jesus said to him, Go thou, and do thou in like manner.

38.verse: And it was done, while they went, he entered into a castle; and a woman, Martha by name, received him into her house. [Forsooth it was done, while they went, and he entered into some castle; and some woman, Martha by name, received him into her house.]

39.verse: And to this was a sister, Mary by name, which also sat beside the feet of the Lord, and heard his word.

40.verse: But Martha busied about the oft service. And she stood, and said, Lord, takest thou no keep, that my sister hath left me alone to serve? therefore say thou to her, that she help me.

41.verse: And the Lord answered, and said to her, Martha, Martha, thou art busy, and art troubled about full many things;

42.verse: but one thing is necessary. Mary hath chosen the best part [Mary hath chosen the better part], which shall not be taken away from her.

1.verse: And it was done, when he was praying in a place [when he was praying in some place], as he ceased, one of his disciples said to him, Lord, teach us to pray, as [and] John taught his disciples.
