2.verse: And he said to them, When ye pray, say ye, Father [Father ours], hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come to; thy will be done on earth, as it is in heaven.

3.verse: Give to us to day our each day's bread.

4.verse: And forgive to us our sins, as [and] we forgive to each man that oweth to us [as and we forgive to each owing to us]. And lead us not into temptation.

5.verse: And he said to them, Who of you shall have a friend, and shall go to him at midnight, and shall say to him, Friend, lend to me three loaves;

6.verse: for my friend cometh to me from the way [for my friend cometh to me of the way], and I have not what I shall set before him.

7.verse: And he withinforth answer and say, Do not thou be heavy to me; the door is now shut, and my children be with me in bed; I may not rise, and give to thee.

8.verse: And if he shall dwell still knocking, I say to you, though he shall not rise, and give to him, for that that he is his friend, nevertheless for his continual asking he shall rise, and give to him [And if he shall continue knocking, I say to you, though he shall not give to him, for he is his friend, nevertheless for his improbity, or continual asking, he shall rise, and give to him], as many as he hath need to.

9.verse: And I say to you, ask ye, and it shall be given to you; seek ye, and ye shall find; knock ye, and it shall be opened to you.

10.verse: For each that asketh, taketh, and he that seeketh, findeth; and to a man that knocketh, it shall be opened.

11.verse: Therefore who of you asketh his father bread, whether he shall give him a stone? or if he asketh fish, whether he shall give him a serpent for the fish?

12.verse: or if he asketh an egg [or if he shall ask an egg], whether he shall areach him a scorpion?

13.verse: Therefore if ye, when ye be evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more your Father of heaven shall give a good Spirit to men that ask him.

14.verse: And Jesus was casting out a fiend [And he was casting out a fiend], and it was dumb. And when he had cast out the fiend, the dumb man spake; and the people wondered.

15.verse: And some of them said, In Beelzebub, prince of devils, he casteth out devils.

16.verse: And others tempting asked of him a token from heaven.

17.verse: And as he saw the thoughts of them, he said to them, Every realm parted against itself, shall be desolate, and an house shall fall on an house.

18.verse: And if Satan be parted against himself, how shall his realm stand? For ye say, that I cast out fiends in Beelzebub.

19.verse: And if I in Beelzebub cast out fiends, in whom cast out your sons [in whom your sons cast out]? Therefore they shall be your doomsmen.

20.verse: But if I cast out fiends in the finger of God, then [soothly] the realm of God is come among you.

21.verse: When a strong, armed man keepeth his house, all things that he wieldeth be in peace.

22.verse: But if a stronger than he come upon him, and overcome him, he shall take away all his armour, in which he trusted, and shall deal abroad his robberies [and shall deal abroad his spoils, or robberies].

23.verse: He that is not with me, is against me; and he that gathereth not together with me, scattereth abroad.

24.verse: When an unclean spirit goeth out of a man, he wandereth by dry places, and seeketh rest [When an unclean spirit hath gone out of a man, he wandereth by dry places, seeking rest]; and he finding none, saith, I shall turn again into mine house, from whence I came out.

25.verse: And when he cometh, he findeth it cleansed with besoms, and fair arrayed [and adorned].

26.verse: Then he goeth, and taketh with him seven other spirits worse than himself, and they enter [in], and dwell there. And the last things of that man be made worse than the former.

27.verse: And it was done, when he had said these things, a woman of the company raised [up] her voice, and said to him, Blessed be the womb that bare thee, and blessed be the teats that thou hast sucked.

28.verse: And he said, But yea blessed be they [And he said, Rather, blessed be they], that hear the word of God, and keep it.

29.verse: And when the people ran together, he began to say, This generation is a wayward generation; it seeketh a token, and a token shall not be given to it, but the token of Jonas, the prophet.

30.verse: For as Jonas was a token to men of Nineve, so man's Son shall be to this generation.

31.verse: The queen of the south shall rise in doom with men of this generation, and shall condemn them; for she came from the ends of the earth, to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and lo! here is a greater than Solomon.

32.verse: Men of Nineve shall rise in [the] doom with this generation, and shall condemn it; for they did penance in the preaching of Jonas [for they did penance at the preaching of Jonas], and lo! here is a greater than Jonas.

33.verse: No man tendeth a lantern, and putteth it in huddles , neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they that go in, see light.

34.verse: The lantern of thy body is thine eye; if thine eye be simple, all thy body shall be light[-full]; but if it be wayward, all thy body shall be dark-full.

35.verse: Therefore see thou, lest the light that is in thee [lest the light which is in thee], be darknesses.

36.verse: Therefore if all thy body be bright, and have no part of darknesses, it shall be all bright, and as a lantern of brightness it shall give light to thee. [Therefore if all thy body shall be light-full, not having any part of darknesses, it shall be all light-full, and as a lantern of brightness, or shining, it shall give light to thee.]

37.verse: And when he spake, a Pharisee prayed him [some Pharisee prayed], that he should eat with him. And he entered, and sat to meat [And he gone in, sat at the meat].

38.verse: And the Pharisee began to say, guessing within himself, why he was not washed before [the] meat.

39.verse: And the Lord said to him, Now ye Pharisees cleanse that that is withoutforth of the cup and the platter; but that thing that is within of you [but that thing of you that is within], is full of raven and wickedness.

40.verse: Fools, whether he that made that that is withoutforth, made not also that that is within?

41.verse: Nevertheless that that is over-plus [Nevertheless that thing that is over, or superfluous], give ye alms, and lo! all things be clean to you.

42.verse: But woe to you, Pharisees, that tithe mint, and rue, and each herb, and leave doom and the charity of God [that tithe mint, and rue, and all wort, or herb, and pass doom and the charity of God]. For it behooved to do these things, and not to leave those.

43.verse: Woe to you, Pharisees, that love the first chairs in synagogues, and salutations in market [and salutations in markets].

44.verse: Woe to you, that be as sepulchres, that be not seen [which appear not], and men walking above know not.

45.verse: But one of the wise men of the law answered, and said to him, Master, thou saying these things, also to us doest despite. [Forsooth one of the wise men of law answering, said to him, Master, thou saying these things, doest despite also to us.]

46.verse: And he said, Also woe to you, wise men of [the] law, for ye charge men with burdens which they be not able to bear [for ye charge men with burdens which they may not bear], and ye yourselves with your one finger touch not the heavinesses.

47.verse: Woe to you, that build tombs of prophets [Woe to you, that build burials, or tombs, of prophets]; and your fathers slew them.

48.verse: Truly ye witness, that ye consent to the works of your fathers; for [soothly] they slew them, but ye build their sepulchres.

49.verse: Therefore [and] the wisdom of God said, I shall send to them prophets and apostles, and of them they shall slay and pursue,

50.verse: that the blood of all [the] prophets, that was shed from the making of the world [that was shed out from the beginning of the world], be sought of this generation;

51.verse: from the blood of just Abel to the blood of Zacharias that was slain betwixt the altar and the house . So I say to you, it shall be sought of this generation.

52.verse: Woe to you, wise men of the law [wise men of law], for ye have taken away the key of knowing; and ye yourselves entered not [ye yourselves entered not in], and ye have forbidden them that entered.

53.verse: And when he said these things to them, the Pharisees and wise men of the law [wise men of law] began grievously to against-stand [him], and [to] stop his mouth of many things,

54.verse: ambushing him, and seeking to take something of his mouth, to accuse him [that they should accuse him].

1.verse: And when much people stood about [Soothly many companies of people standing about], so that they trod each on other, he began to say to his disciples, Be ye ware of the sourdough of the Pharisees, that is hypocrisy [which is hypocrisy].

2.verse: For nothing is covered, that shall not be showed; neither hid, that shall not be known.

3.verse: For why those things that ye have said in darknesses, shall be said in light; and that that ye have spoken in [the] ear in bedchambers [and that that ye have spoken in the ear in couches], shall be preached in roofs.

4.verse: And I say to you, my friends, be ye not afeared of them [be not afeared of them] that slay the body, and after these things have no more what they shall do.

5.verse: But I shall show to you, whom ye shall dread; dread ye him, that after he hath slain [which after he hath slain], hath power to send into hell. And so I say to you, dread ye him.

6.verse: Whether five sparrows be not sold for two halfpence [for two farthings]; and one of them is not in forgetting before God?

7.verse: But also all the hairs of your head be numbered. Therefore do not ye dread; ye be of more price than many sparrows.

8.verse: Truly I say to you, each man that acknowledgeth me before men [Truly I say to you, whoever shall acknowledge me before men], man's Son shall acknowledge him before the angels of God.

9.verse: But he that denieth me before men, shall be denied before the angels of God.

10.verse: And each that saith a word against man's Son, it shall be forgiven to him; but it shall not be forgiven to him, that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost. [And each that saith a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven to him; he that shall blaspheme into the Holy Ghost, soothly it shall not be forgiven to him.]

11.verse: And when they lead you into synagogues, and to magistrates, and potentates, do not ye be busy, how or what ye shall answer, or what ye shall say.

12.verse: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in that hour, what it behooveth you to say.

13.verse: And one of the people said to him [Soothly some man of the company saith to him], Master, say to my brother, that he part with me the heritage.

14.verse: And he said to him, Man, who ordained me a doomsman, or a parter, on you [over you]?

15.verse: And he said to them, See ye, and beware of all covetousness; for the life of a man is not in the abundance of the things, which he wieldeth.

16.verse: And he told to them a likeness, and said, The field of a rich man brought forth plenteous fruits. [Soothly he said to them a likeness, saying, The field of some rich man brought forth plenteous fruits.]

17.verse: And he thought within himself, and said [saying], What shall I do, for I have not whither I shall gather my fruits?

18.verse: And he saith, This thing I shall do; I shall throw down my barns, and I shall make greater, and thither I shall gather all things that grow to me, and my goods.

19.verse: And I shall say to my soul, Soul, thou hast many goods kept into full many years [thou hast many goods put up, or kept, into full many years]; rest thou, eat, drink, and make feast.

20.verse: And God said to him, Fool, in this night they shall take thy life from thee. And whose shall those things be, that thou hast arrayed? [Soothly God said to him, Fool, in this night they shall ask of thee thy soul. Forsooth whose shall those things be, which thou hast made ready?]

21.verse: So is he that treasureth to himself, and is not rich in God.

22.verse: And he said to his disciples, Therefore I say to you, do not ye be busy to your life, what ye shall eat, neither to your body, with what ye shall be clothed.

23.verse: The life is more than meat, and the body more than clothing.

24.verse: Behold the crows, for they sow not, neither reap [nor reap], to which is neither cellar, nor barn, and God feedeth them. How much more ye be of more price than they [How much more be ye of more price than they(?)].

25.verse: And who of you by thinking may put one cubit to his stature [may add one cubit to his stature]?

26.verse: Therefore if ye be not able to do that that is least [Therefore if ye may not do that that is least], what be ye busy of other things?

27.verse: Behold ye the lilies of the field, how they wax; they travail not, neither spin. And I say to you, that neither Solomon in all his glory was clothed as one of these.

28.verse: And if God clotheth thus the hay, that to day is in the field [which to day is in the field], and to morrow is cast into an oven; how much more you of little faith.

29.verse: And do not ye seek, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; and do not ye be raised on high.

30.verse: For folks of the world seek all these things; and your Father knoweth, that ye have need to all these things.

31.verse: Nevertheless seek ye first the kingdom of God, and all these things shall be cast to you.

32.verse: Do not ye, little flock, dread, for it pleased to your Father to give you a kingdom.

33.verse: Sell ye those things that ye have in possession [Sell ye those things that ye wield], and give ye alms. And make to you satchels that wax not old, treasure that faileth not in heavens, whither a thief approacheth not [whither a thief nigheth not], neither moth destroyeth.

34.verse: For where is thy treasure, there thine heart shall be. [Forsooth where thy treasure is, there also thine heart shall be.]

35.verse: Be your loins girded above, and lanterns burning in your hands;

36.verse: and be ye like to men that abide their lord [and ye like to men abiding their lord], when he shall turn again from the weddings, that when he shall come, and knock, at once [anon] they open to him.

37.verse: Blessed be those servants, that when the lord shall come [whom when the lord shall come], he shall find waking. Truly I say to you, that he shall gird himself, and make them sit to meat [and make them sit at the meat], and he shall go, and serve them.

38.verse: And if he [shall] come in the second waking, and if he come in the third waking, and find so, those servants be blessed.

39.verse: And know ye this thing, for if an husbandman knew, in what hour the thief would come, soothly he should wake, and not suffer his house to be mined [and suffer not his house to be mined].

40.verse: And be ye ready, for in what hour ye guess not, man's Son shall come.

41.verse: And Peter said to him, Lord, sayest thou this parable to us, or to all?

42.verse: And the Lord said, Who, guessest thou, is a true dispenser, and prudent [Who, guessest thou, is a faithful dispenser, and prudent], whom the lord hath ordained on [upon] his household, to give them in time a measure of wheat?

43.verse: Blessed is that servant, that the lord when he cometh, shall find so doing. [Blessed is that servant, whom when the lord shall come, he shall find so doing.]

44.verse: Verily I say to you, that on [upon] all things that he wieldeth, he shall ordain him.

45.verse: That if that servant say in his heart, My lord tarrieth to come; and begin to smite children, and handmaidens, and eat, and drink, and be full-filled over measure [and be filled over measure],

46.verse: the lord of that servant shall come, in the day that he hopeth not, and in the hour that he knoweth not, and shall part him (in pieces), and [shall] put his part with unfaithful men.

47.verse: But that servant that knew the will of his lord, and made not him(self) ready, and did not after his will, shall be beaten with many beatings.

48.verse: But he that knew not, and did worthy things of strokes, shall be beaten with few. For to each man to whom much is given, much shall be asked of him; and they shall ask more of him, to whom they betook much.

49.verse: I came to send fire into the earth, and what will I, but that it be kindled?

50.verse: And I have to be baptized with a baptism, and how am I constrained, till that it be perfectly done [till it be perfectly done]?

51.verse: Ween ye [Guess ye], that I came to give peace into [the] earth? Nay, I say to you, but parting.

52.verse: For from this time there shall be five parted in one house; three shall be parted against twain, and twain shall be parted against three;

53.verse: the father against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the husband's mother against the son's wife, and the son's wife against her husband's mother.

54.verse: And he said also to the people, When ye see a cloud rising from the sun going down, at once ye say [anon ye say], Rain cometh; and so it is done.

55.verse: And when ye see the south blowing, ye say, That heat shall be; and it is done.

56.verse: Hypocrites, ye know how to prove the face of heaven and of earth, but how prove ye not this time[?]

57.verse: But what and of yourselves ye deem not that that is just? [Forsooth why and of yourselves deem ye not this thing that is just?]

58.verse: But when thou goest with thine adversary in the way to the prince, do busyness to be delivered from him; lest peradventure he take thee to the doomsman [Forsooth when thou goest with thine adversary to the prince in the way, give thou busyness to be delivered from him; lest peradventure he draw thee to the doomsman], and the doomsman betake thee to the masterful asker, and the masterful asker send thee into prison.

59.verse: I say to thee, thou shalt not go out from thence [I say to thee, Thou shalt not go thence], till thou yield the last farthing.

1.verse: And some men were present in that time, that told to him of the Galilaeans, whose blood Pilate mingled with the sacrifices of them.

2.verse: And he answered, and said to them, Ween ye, that these men of Galilee were sinners more than all Galilaeans, for they suffered such things? [And he answering said to them, Ween ye, that these men of Galilee were sinners before all Galilaeans, for they suffered such things?]

3.verse: I say to you, nay; all ye shall perish in like manner, but [if] ye have penance.

4.verse: And as those eighteen, on which the tower in Siloam fell down [upon whom the tower in Siloam felled down], and slew them, guess ye, that they were debtors more than all men that dwell in Jerusalem?

5.verse: I say to you, nay; but also all ye shall perish [but also ye all shall perish], if ye do not penance.

6.verse: And he said this likeness, A man [Some man] had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit in it, and found none.

7.verse: And he said to the tiller of the vineyard, Lo! three years be, since I come seeking fruit in this fig tree, and I find none; therefore cut it down, whereto occupieth it the earth?

8.verse: And he answering said to him, Lord, suffer it also this year, [till] the while I delve about it, and I shall dung it [till the while I delve about it, and dung it];

9.verse: [and] if it shall make fruit, [else] if not, in time [to] coming thou shalt cut it down.

10.verse: And he was teaching in their synagogue in the sabbaths. [Forsooth he was teaching in the synagogue of them in sabbaths.]

11.verse: And lo! a woman, that had a spirit of sickness eighteen years, and was crooked [and was bowed down], and neither in any manner might look upward.

12.verse: Whom when Jesus had seen, he called [her] to him, and said to her, Woman, thou art delivered of thy sickness [Woman, thou art let go of thy sickness].

13.verse: And he set on her his hands, and at once she stood upright [And he put to her the hands, and anon she was raised], and glorified God.

14.verse: And the prince of the synagogue answered, having disdain for Jesus had healed in the sabbath; and he said to the people, There be six days, in which it behooveth to work; therefore come ye in these [therefore come in these], and be ye healed, and not in the day of sabbath.

15.verse: But the Lord answered to him, and said, Hypocrite, whether each of you untieth not in the sabbath his ox, or ass, from the feed-trough, and leadeth to water?

16.verse: Behooved it not this daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo! eighteen years, to be unbound of this bond in the day of sabbath?

17.verse: And when he said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed, and all the people joyed in all things, that were gloriously done of him.

18.verse: Therefore he said, To what thing is the kingdom of God like? and to what thing shall I guess it to be like?

19.verse: It is like to a corn of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his garden [cast into his yard]; and it waxed, and was made into a great tree, and fowls of the air rested in the branches thereof.

20.verse: And again he said, To what thing shall I guess the kingdom of God like?

21.verse: It is like to sourdough, that a woman took, and hid it in three measures of meal, till all were soured.

22.verse: And he went by cities and castles, teaching and making journey into Jerusalem.

23.verse: And a man said to him, Lord, if there be few, that be saved? And he said to them,

24.verse: Strive ye to enter by the strait gate; for I say to you, many seek to enter [in], and they shall not be able.

25.verse: For when the husbandman is entered, and the door is closed [Forsooth when the husbandman hath entered and closed the door], ye shall begin to stand withoutforth, and knock at the door, and say [saying], Lord, open to us. And he shall answer, and say to you, I know you not, of whence ye be.

26.verse: Then ye shall begin to say, We have eaten before thee and drunk [We have eaten and drunk before thee], and in our streets thou hast taught.

27.verse: And he shall say to you, I know you not, of whence ye be; go away from me, all ye workers of wickedness.

28.verse: There shall be weeping and grinding of teeth [There shall be weeping and beating together of teeth], when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God; and you to be put out.

29.verse: And they shall come from the east and the west, and from the north and the south, and shall sit at the meat in the realm of God.

30.verse: And lo! they that were the first, be the last; and they that were the last, be the first. [And lo! they that were first, be the last; and they that were last, be the first.]

31.verse: In that day some of the Pharisees came nigh, and said to him, Go out, and go from hence [In that day some of the Pharisees came nigh, saying to him, Go out, and go hence], for Herod will slay thee.

32.verse: And he said to them, Go ye, and say to that fox, Lo! I cast out fiends, and I make perfectly healings [and I make perfectly healths], to day and to morrow, and the third day I am ended.

33.verse: Nevertheless it behooveth me to day, and to morrow, and the day that followeth [and the day following], to walk; for it falleth not [for] a prophet to perish out of Jerusalem.

34.verse: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that slayest prophets, and stonest them that be sent to thee, how oft would I gather together thy sons, as a bird gathereth his nest under feathers [as a bird his nest under pens, or wings], and thou wouldest not.

35.verse: Lo! your house shall be left to you desert. And I say to you [Soothly I say to you], that ye shall not see me, till it come, when ye shall say, Blessed is he, that cometh in the name of the Lord.

1.verse: And it was done, when he had entered into the house of a prince of Pharisees, in the sabbath, to eat bread, they espied him.

2.verse: And lo! a man sick in the dropsy [And lo! some man sick in the dropsy] was before him.

3.verse: And Jesus answering spake to the wise men of [the] law, and to the Pharisees, and said [saying], Whether it is leaveful to heal in the sabbath?

4.verse: And they held peace. And Jesus took, and healed him, and let him go.

5.verse: And he answered to them, and said, Whose ass or ox of you shall fall into a pit, and he shall not at once draw him out in the day of sabbath?

6.verse: And they might not answer to him to these things.

7.verse: He said also a parable to men bidden to a feast, and he beheld how they chose the first sitting places, and said to them, [Forsooth he said also a parable to men bidden to a feast, beholding how they chose the first sitting places, saying to them,]

8.verse: When thou art bidden to bridals, sit not to meat in the first place [When thou shalt be bidden to weddings, sit not at the meat in the first place]; lest peradventure a worthier than thou be bidden of him,

9.verse: and lest he come that called thee and him, and say to thee, Give place to this, and then thou shalt begin with shame [and thou shalt begin with shame] to hold the lowest place.

10.verse: But when thou art bidden to a feast, go, and sit down in the last place, that when he cometh, that bade thee to the feast, he say to thee, Friend, come higher [Friend, ascend up higher]. Then worship shall be to thee, before men that sit [together] at the meat.

11.verse: For each that enhanceth himself, shall be lowed [shall be made low]; and he that meeketh himself, shall be highed.

12.verse: And he said [also] to him, that had bidden him to the feast, When thou makest a meat, or a supper, do not thou call thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy cousins, neither neighbours, nor rich men; lest peradventure [and] they bid thee again to the feast, and it be yielded again to thee [and retribution, or yielding again, be made to thee].

13.verse: But when thou makest a feast, call poor men, feeble [men], crooked, and blind,

14.verse: and thou shalt be blessed; for they have not whereof to yield [again] to thee, for it shall be yielded to thee [forsooth it shall be requited to thee] in the rising again of just men.

15.verse: And when one of them that sat together at the meat had heard these things, he said to him, Blessed is he, that shall eat bread in the realm of God.

16.verse: And he said to him, A man made a great supper [Some man made a great supper], and called many.

17.verse: And he sent his servant in the hour of supper, to say to men that were bidden to the feast, that they should come, for now all things be ready.

18.verse: And all began together to excuse them(selves). The first said [to him], I have bought a town, and I have need to go out, and see it; I pray thee, have me excused.

19.verse: And the tother said, I have bought five yokes of oxen, and I go to prove them; I pray thee, have me excused.

20.verse: And another said, I have wedded a wife; and therefore I may not come.

21.verse: And the servant turned again, and told these things to his lord. Then the husbandman was wroth, and said to his servant, Go out swiftly into the great streets and the small streets of the city [Then the husbandman wroth, said to his servant, Go out soon into great streets and small streets of the city], and bring in hither poor men, and feeble, [and] blind men, and crooked.

22.verse: And the servant said, Lord, it is done, as thou hast commanded, and yet there is a void place [and yet there is a place].

23.verse: And the lord said to the servant, Go out into ways and hedges, and constrain men to enter, that mine house be full-filled [that mine house be filled].

24.verse: For I say to you, that none of those men that be called, shall taste my supper.

25.verse: And much people went with him [Soothly many companies went with him]; and he turned, and said to them,

26.verse: If any man cometh to me [If any man come to me], and hateth not his father, and mother, and wife, and sons, and brethren, and sisters, and yet [forsooth] his own life, he may not be my disciple.

27.verse: And he that beareth not his cross, and cometh after me, may not be my disciple.

28.verse: For who of you willing to build a tower, whether he sit not first/whether he first sitteth not, and counteth the expenses that be needful, if he have to perform?

29.verse: Lest after that he hath set the foundament [Lest after he hath put the foundament], and be not able to perform, all that see, begin to scorn him,

30.verse: and say [saying], For this man began to build, and might not make an end.

31.verse: Or what king that will go to do a battle against another king, whether he sitteth not first, and bethinketh, if he may with ten thousand go to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?

32.verse: [Or] Else yet while he is afar, he sendeth a messenger, and prayeth those things that be of peace.

33.verse: So therefore each of you, that forsaketh not all things that he hath [that renounceth not, or forsaketh not, all things that he wieldeth], may not be my disciple.

34.verse: Salt is good; but if salt [shall] vanish, in what thing shall it be savoured?

35.verse: Neither in earth, nor in [the] dunghill it is profitable, but it shall be cast out. He that hath ears of hearing, hear he.

1.verse: And publicans and sinful men were approaching to him [were nighing to him], to hear him.

2.verse: And the Pharisees and scribes grumbled [grutched], saying, For this [man] receiveth sinful men, and eateth with them.

3.verse: And he spake to them this parable, and said [saying],

4.verse: What man of you that hath an hundred sheep, and if he hath lost one of them, whether he leaveth not ninety and nine in desert [and if he shall lose one of them, whether he leave not ninety and nine in desert], and goeth to it that perished, till he find it?

5.verse: And when he hath found it, he joyeth, and layeth it on his shoulders; [And when he hath found it, he joying putteth on his shoulders;]

6.verse: and he cometh home, and calleth together his friends and neighbours, and saith to them, Be ye glad with me, for I have found my sheep, that had perished.

7.verse: And I say to you, so joy shall be in heaven on one sinful man doing penance, more than on ninety and nine just, that have no need to penance [than of ninety and nine just, that have no need of penance].

8.verse: Or what woman having ten bezants, and if she hath lost one bezant, whether she tendeth not a lantern, and turneth upside-down the house , and seeketh diligently, till [that] she find it?

9.verse: And when she hath found, she calleth together friends and neighbours, and saith, Be ye glad with me, for I have found the bezant that I had lost [saying, Glad ye with me, for I have found the drachma, which I had lost].

10.verse: So I say to you, joy shall be before the angels of God on [upon] one sinful man doing penance.

11.verse: And he said, A man had two sons [Some man had two sons];

12.verse: and the younger of them said to the father, Father, give me the portion of chattel, that falleth to me. And he parted to them the chattel.

13.verse: And not after many days, when all things were gathered together, the younger son went forth in pilgrimage into a far country; and there he wasted his goods in living lecherously [and there he wasted his substance, or goods, in living lecherously].

14.verse: And after that he had ended all things, a strong hunger was made in that country, and he began to have need.

15.verse: And he went, and drew him(self) to one of the citizens of that country [And he went, and cleaved to one of the citizens of that country]. And he sent him into his town, to feed swine.

16.verse: And he coveted to fill his womb of the pods that the hogs ate, and no man gave to him.

17.verse: And he turned again to himself, and said, How many hired men in my father's house have plenty of loaves; and I perish here through hunger [forsooth I perish here in hunger].

18.verse: I shall rise up, and go to my father, and I shall say to him, Father, I have sinned into heaven [Father, I have sinned against heaven], and before thee;

19.verse: and now I am not worthy to be called thy son, make me as one of thine hired men.

20.verse: And he rose up, and came to his father. And when he was yet afar, his father saw him, and was stirred by mercy. And he ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

21.verse: And the son said to him, Father, I have sinned into heaven [Father, I have sinned against heaven], and before thee; and now I am not worthy to be called thy son.

22.verse: And the father said to his servants, Swiftly bring ye forth the first stole, and clothe ye him [and clothe him], and give ye a ring in his hand, and shoes on his feet;

23.verse: and bring ye a fat calf, and slay ye, and eat we, and make we feast.

24.verse: For this my son was dead, and hath lived again; he perished, and is found. And all men began to eat [And all began for to eat gladly].

25.verse: But his elder son was in the field; and when he came, and approached to the house [and nighed to the house], he heard a symphony and a crowd.

26.verse: And he called one of the servants, and asked, what these things were.

27.verse: And he said to him, Thy brother is come, and thy father slew a fat calf , for he received him safe.

28.verse: And he was wroth, and would not come in. Therefore his father went out, and began to pray him.

29.verse: And he answered to his father, and said, Lo! so many years I serve thee, and I never brake thy commandment; and thou never gave to me a kid, that I with my friends should have eaten.

30.verse: But after that this thy son, that hath devoured his substance with whores, came, thou hast slain to him a fat calf.

31.verse: And he said to him, Son, thou art evermore with me [Son, thou art ever with me], and all my things be thine.

32.verse: But it behooved to make feast, and to have joy; for this thy brother was dead, and lived again [and liveth again]; he perished, and is found.

1.verse: He said also to his disciples, There was a rich man, that had a bailiff [There was some rich man, that had a farmer, or bailee]; and this was denounced to him, as he had wasted his goods.

2.verse: And he called him, and said to him, What hear I this thing of thee? yield reckoning of thy bailiffship, for thou might not now be bailiff .

3.verse: And the bailiff said within himself, What shall I do, for my lord taketh away from me the bailiffship? delve may I not, I shame to beg. [Forsooth the farmer said within himself, What shall I do, for my lord taketh away from me the farm? I may not delve, I am ashamed to beg.]

4.verse: I know what I shall do, that when I am removed from the bailiffship [that when I shall be removed from the farm], they receive me into their houses.

5.verse: Therefore when all the debtors of his lord were called together [And so all the debtors of his lord called together], he said to the first, How much owest thou to my lord?

6.verse: And he said, An hundred barrows of oil. And he said to him, Take thy caution [Take thy caution, or obligation], and sit soon, and write fifty.

7.verse: Afterward he said to another, And how much owest thou? Which answered, An hundred cors of wheat [Which said, An hundred measures of wheat]. And he said to him, Take thy letters, and write fourscore.

8.verse: And the lord praised the bailiff of wickedness [And the lord praised the farmer of wickedness], for he had done prudently; for the sons of this world be more prudent in their generation than the sons of light.

9.verse: And I say to you, make ye to you friends of the riches of wickedness [make to you friends of the riches of wickedness], that when ye shall fail, they receive you into everlasting tabernacles.

10.verse: He that is true in the least thing, is true also in the more [He that is faithful in the least thing, is faithful also in the more]; and he that is wicked in a little thing, is wicked also in the more.

11.verse: Therefore if ye were not true in the wicked thing of riches [Therefore if ye were not true in the wicked riches], who shall betake to you that that is very?

12.verse: And if ye were not true in other men's thing, who shall give to you that that is yours?

13.verse: No servant may serve to two lords; for either he shall hate the one, and love the other; either he shall draw to the one, and despise the other. Ye be not able to serve to God and to riches.

14.verse: But the Pharisees, that were covetous, heard all these things, and they scorned him.

15.verse: And he said to them, Ye it be, that justify you before men; but God hath known your hearts [soothly God knoweth your hearts], for that that is high to men, is abomination before God.

16.verse: The law and the prophets till to John; from that time the realm of God is evangelized [from that time the realm of God is preached], and each man doeth violence into it.

17.verse: Forsooth it is lighter heaven and earth [for] to pass, than that one tittle fall from the law [than one tittle fall of the law].

18.verse: Every man that forsaketh his wife, and weddeth another, doeth lechery [doeth adultery]; and he that weddeth the wife forsaken of the husband, doeth adultery.

19.verse: There was a rich man [Some man was rich], and was clothed in purple, and white silk, and ate every day shiningly.

20.verse: And there was a beggar [And there was some beggar], Lazarus by name, that lay at his gate full of boils,

21.verse: and coveted to be fulfilled of the crumbs , that fell down from the rich man's board, and no man gave to him; but [and] hounds came, and licked his boils.

22.verse: And it was done, that the beggar died, and was borne of angels into Abraham's bosom. And the rich man was dead also, and was buried in hell.

23.verse: And he raised up his eyes, when he was in torments, and saw Abraham afar, and Lazarus in his bosom.

24.verse: And he cried, and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he dip the end of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.

25.verse: And Abraham said to him, Son, have mind, for thou hast received good things in thy life, and Lazarus also evil things; but he is now comforted, and thou art tormented.

26.verse: And in all these things a great dark place is stablished betwixt us and you; that they that will from hence pass to you, be not able , neither from thence pass over hither.

27.verse: And he said, Then I pray thee, father, that thou send him into the house of my father.

28.verse: For I have five brethren, that he witness to them, lest also they come into this place of torments.

29.verse: And Abraham said to him [And Abraham saith to him], They have Moses and the prophets; hear they them.

30.verse: And he said, Nay, father Abraham, but if any of dead men [shall] go to them, they shall do penance.

31.verse: And he said to him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither if any of dead men [shall] rise again, they shall believe to him.

1.verse: And Jesus said to his disciples, It is impossible that causes of stumbling come not; but woe to that man, by whom they come. [And he said to his disciples, It is impossible that offences come not; but woe to him, by whom they come.]

2.verse: It is more profitable to him, if a millstone be put about his neck, and he be cast into the sea, than that he cause to stumble one of these little [than that he offend one of these little].

3.verse: Take ye heed to yourselves [Take heed to yourselves]; if thy brother hath sinned against thee, blame him; and if he do penance, forgive him.

4.verse: And if seven times in the day he do sin against thee, and seven times in the day he be converted to thee, and say, It repenteth me, forgive thou him.

5.verse: And the apostles said to the Lord, Increase to us faith [Increase faith to us].

6.verse: And the Lord said, If ye have faith as the corn of mustard seed [If ye had faith as a corn of mustard seed], ye shall say to this (syca)more tree, Be thou drawn up by the root, and be over-planted into the sea [and be thou planted over into the sea], and it shall obey to you.

7.verse: But who of you hath a servant plowing, or pasturing oxen, which saith to him, when he turneth again from the field, At once go, and sit to meat;

8.verse: and saith not to him, Make ready, that I sup, and gird thee, and serve me, while I eat and drink, and after this thou shalt eat and drink; [and not saith to him, Make ready, that I sup, and gird thee before, and minister to me, till that I eat and drink, and after these things thou shalt eat and drink;]

9.verse: whether he hath grace to that servant, for he did that that he commanded him? Nay, I guess.

10.verse: So [also] ye, when ye have done all things that be commanded to you, say ye [say], We be unprofitable servants, we have done that that we ought to do.

11.verse: And it was done, the while Jesus went to Jerusalem, he passed through the midst of Samaria, and Galilee.

12.verse: And when he entered into a castle [And when he entered into some castle], ten leprous men came to meet him, which stood afar,

13.verse: and raised their voice [and lifted up their voice], and said, Jesus, Commander, have mercy on us.

14.verse: And as he saw them, he said [Whom, when he saw, he said], Go, show ye you to the priests. And it was done, while they went, they were cleansed.

15.verse: And one of them, as he saw that he was cleansed, went again, magnifying God with a great voice.

16.verse: And he fell down on the face before his feet, and did thankings [doing graces, or thankings]; and this was a Samaritan.

17.verse: And Jesus answered, and said [Forsooth Jesus answering said], Whether ten be not cleansed, and where be the nine?

18.verse: There is none found, that turned again, and gave glory to God, but this alien [but this alien, or stranger].

19.verse: And he said to him, Rise up, go thou; for thy faith hath made thee safe.

20.verse: And he was asked of the Pharisees, when the realm of God cometh. And he answered to them, and said, The realm of God cometh not with espying,

21.verse: neither they shall say, Lo! here, or lo[!] there; for lo! the realm of God is within you.

22.verse: And he said to his disciples, Days shall come, when ye shall desire to see one day of man's Son, and ye shall not see.

23.verse: And they shall say to you, Lo! here, and lo! there. Do not ye go, neither follow;

24.verse: for as lightning shining from under heaven shineth into those things [shineth on those things] that be under heaven, so shall man's Son be in his day.

25.verse: But first it behooveth him to suffer many things, and to be reproved of this generation.

26.verse: And as it was done in the days of Noe, so it shall be in the days of man's Son.

27.verse: They ate and drank, wedded wives, and were given to weddings, till into the day in which Noe entered into the ship; and the great flood came, and destroyed all [and lost all].

28.verse: Also as it was done in the days of Lot, they ate and drank, bought and sold, planted and builded;

29.verse: but in the day that Lot went out of Sodom, the Lord rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed all [and lost all].

30.verse: Like this thing it shall be [After this thing it shall be], in what day man's Son shall be showed.

31.verse: In that hour he that is in the roof [In that day he that shall be in the roof], and his vessels in the house, come he not down to take them away; and he that shall be in the field [and he that is in the field], also turn not again behind.

32.verse: Be ye mindful of the wife of Lot.

33.verse: Whoever seeketh to make his life safe, shall lose it; and whoever loseth it, shall quicken it. [Whoever shall seek to make his life safe, shall lose it; and whoever shall lose it, shall quicken it.]

34.verse: But I say to you [I say to you], in that night two shall be in one bed, one shall be taken, and the other [shall be] forsaken;

35.verse: two women shall be grinding together, the one shall be taken, and the other forsaken [and the tother shall be forsaken];

36.verse: two in a field, the one shall be taken, and the other left.

37.verse: They answer, and say to him, Where, Lord? Which said to them, Where ever the body shall be, thither shall be gathered together also the eagles. [They answering said to him, Where Lord? Which said to them, Where ever the body shall be, also the eagles shall be gathered together thither.]

1.verse: And he said to them also a parable, that it behooveth to pray evermore, and not [to] fail; [Forsooth he said also a parable to them, for it behooveth to pray ever, and not to fail;]

2.verse: and said, There was a judge in a city, that dreaded not God, neither shamed of men.

3.verse: And a widow was in that city, and she came to him, and said [saying], Venge me of mine adversary;

4.verse: and he would not long time [and he would not by much time]. But after these things he said within himself, Though I dread not God, and shame not of man,

5.verse: nevertheless for this widow is heavy to me, I shall venge her; lest at the last she coming condemn me [lest at the last she coming strangle me].

6.verse: And the Lord said, Hear ye, what the doomsman of wickedness saith;

7.verse: and whether God shall not do [the] vengeance of his chosen, crying to him day and night, and shall have patience in them?

8.verse: Soothly I say to you, for soon he shall do [the] vengeance of them. Nevertheless guessest thou, that man's Son coming shall find faith in earth?

9.verse: And he said also to some men, that trusted in themselves, as they were rightful, and despised others, this parable, saying,

10.verse: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

11.verse: And the Pharisee stood, and prayed by himself these things, and said [Forsooth the Pharisee standing, prayed with himself these things, saying], God, I do thankings to thee, for I am not as other men, raveners, unjust, adulterers, as also this publican;

12.verse: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all things that I have in possession.

13.verse: And the publican stood afar, and would not raise his eyes to heaven, but smote his breast, and said [And the publican standing afar would not neither lift up the eyes to heaven, but smote his breast, saying], God be merciful to me, sinner.

14.verse: Truly I say to you, this went down into his house, and was justified from the other. For each that enhanceth himself, shall be made low, and he that meeketh himself, shall be enhanced.

15.verse: And they brought to him young children, that he should touch them; and when the disciples saw this thing, they blamed them.

16.verse: But Jesus called together them, and said, Suffer ye children to come to me, and do not ye forbid them, for of such is the kingdom of heavens.

17.verse: Truly I say to you, whoever shall not take the kingdom of God as a child, he shall not enter into it.

18.verse: And a prince asked him, and said, Good master, in what thing doing shall I wield everlasting life? [And some prince asked him, saying, Good master, what thing doing shall I wield everlasting life?]

19.verse: And Jesus said to him, What sayest thou me good? No man is good, but God alone.

20.verse: Thou knowest the commandments, Thou shalt not slay, Thou shalt not do lechery, Thou shalt not do theft, Thou shalt not say false witnessing, Honour thy father and thy mother [Worship thy father and thy mother].

21.verse: Which said, I have kept all these things from my youth.

22.verse: And when this thing was heard, Jesus said to him, Yet one thing faileth to thee; sell thou all things that thou hast, and give to poor men, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven; and come, and follow thou me [and come, and follow me].

23.verse: And when these things were heard, he was sorrowful, for he was full rich.

24.verse: And Jesus seeing him made sorry, said, How hard they that have money shall enter into the kingdom of God; [Soothly Jesus seeing him made sorrowful said, How hard they that have riches shall enter into the realm of God;]

25.verse: for it is lighter a camel to pass through a needle's eye, than a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God. [forsooth it is easier a camel to pass through a needle's eye, than a rich man for to enter into the kingdom of God.]

26.verse: And they that heard these things said, [And] Who may be made safe?

27.verse: And he said to them, Those things that be impossible with men, be possible with God.

28.verse: But Peter said, Lo! we have left all things, and have followed thee [and follow thee].

29.verse: And he said to him, Truly I say to you, there is no man that shall forsake house, or father and mother, or brethren, or wife, or children, or fields, for the realm of God,

30.verse: and shall not receive many more things in this time, and in the world to coming everlasting life [and in the world to come everlasting life].

31.verse: And Jesus took his twelve disciples, and said to them, Lo! we go up to Jerusalem, and all things shall be ended, that be written by the prophets of man's Son.

32.verse: For he shall be betrayed to heathen men, and he shall be scorned, and scourged, and bespat;

33.verse: and after that they have scourged him, they shall slay him, and the third day he shall rise again.

34.verse: And they understood nothing of these; and this word was hid from them, and they understood not those things that were said.

35.verse: But it was done, when Jesus came nigh to Jericho, a blind man sat beside the way, and begged [some blind man sat beside the way begging].

36.verse: And when he heard the people passing [And when he heard the company of people passing], he asked, what this was.

37.verse: And they said to him, that Jesus of Nazareth passed.

38.verse: And he cried, and said [saying], Jesus, the son of David, have mercy on me.

39.verse: And they that went before blamed him, that he should be still; but he cried much the more [soothly he cried much more], Thou son of David, have mercy on me.

40.verse: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought forth to him. And when he came nigh, he asked him, and said [saying],

41.verse: What wilt thou that I shall do to thee? And he said, Lord, that I see.

42.verse: And Jesus said to him, Behold; thy faith hath made thee safe.

43.verse: And at once he saw, and followed him, and magnified God [And anon he saw, and followed him, magnifying God]. And all the people, as it saw [that it saw], gave praising to God.

1.verse: And Jesus going in, walked through Jericho.

2.verse: And lo! a man, Zacchaeus by name, and this was [and he was] a prince of publicans, and he was rich.

3.verse: And he sought to see Jesus, who he was, and he might not, for the people [for the company of people], for he was little in stature.

4.verse: And he ran before, and ascended [up] into a sycamore tree, to see him; for he was to pass from thence [for he was to pass thence].

5.verse: And Jesus beheld up, when he came to the place, and saw him, and said to him, Zacchaeus, haste thee, and come down, for to day I must dwell in thine house.

6.verse: And he hieing came down [And he hasting came down], and joying received him.

7.verse: And when all men saw, they grumbled [they grutched], saying, For he had turned to a sinful man.

8.verse: But Zacchaeus stood, and said to the Lord, Lo! Lord, I give the half of my goods to poor men; and if I have any thing defrauded any man, I yield four so much [I yield fourfold].

9.verse: Jesus saith to him, For to day health is made to this house, for that he is Abraham's son; [Jesus said to him, For in this day health is made to this house, for and he is the son of Abraham;]

10.verse: for man's Son came to seek, and make safe that thing that perished.

11.verse: When they heard these things, he added, and said a parable, for that he was nigh to Jerusalem, and for they guessed, that at once the kingdom of God should be showed [and for they guessed, that the kingdom of God should be showed anon].

12.verse: Therefore he said, A worthy man went into a far country [Some nobleman went into a far country], to take to him a kingdom, and to turn again.

13.verse: And when his ten servants were called, he gave to them ten bezants; and said to them, Chaffer ye [Merchandize ye], till I come.

14.verse: But his citizens hated him, and sent a messenger after him, and said, We will not, that he reign on us.

15.verse: And it was done, that he turned again, when he had taken the kingdom; and he commanded his servants to be called, to which he had given money, to know [to whom he gave money, that he should know], how much each had won by chaffering.

16.verse: And the first came, and said [saying], Lord, thy bezant hath won ten bezants.

17.verse: He said to him, Well be, thou good servant; for in little thing thou hast been true, thou shalt be having power on ten cities [thou shalt have power upon ten cities].

18.verse: And the tother came, and said [And the tother came, saying], Lord, thy bezant hath made five bezants.

19.verse: And to this he said, And be thou on five cities. [And he said to this, And be thou upon five cities.]

20.verse: And the third came, and said, Lord, lo! thy bezant, that I had, put up in a sudarium.

21.verse: For I dreaded thee, for thou art an austere man; thou takest away that that thou settedest not, and thou reapest that that thou hast not sown.

22.verse: He saith to him, Wicked servant, of thy mouth I deem thee. Knewest thou, that I am an austere man, taking away that thing that I setted not, and reaping that thing that I sowed not ?

23.verse: and why hast thou not given my money to the board, and I coming should have asked it with usuries? [and why hast thou not given my money to the board, that and I coming should have received it soothly with usuries?]

24.verse: And he said to men standing nigh, Take away from him the bezant, and give ye to him that hath ten bezants.

25.verse: And they said to him, Lord, he hath ten bezants.

26.verse: And I say to you, to each man that hath, it shall be given, and he shall increase [and he shall abound]; but from him that hath not, also that thing that he hath, shall be taken of him [shall be taken from him].

27.verse: Nevertheless bring ye hither those mine enemies, that would not that I reigned on them [that would not me to reign upon them], and slay ye before me.

28.verse: And when these things were said, he went before, and went up to Jerusalem. [And these things said, he went before, ascending to Jerusalem.]

29.verse: And it was done, when Jesus came nigh to Bethphage and Bethany [when he came nigh to Bethphage and Bethany], at the mount, that is called of Olives, he sent his two disciples,

30.verse: and said [saying], Go ye into the castle, that is against you; into which as ye enter [into which ye entering], ye shall find a colt of an ass tied, on which never man sat; untie ye him, and bring ye to me.

31.verse: And if any man ask you, why ye untie, thus ye shall say to him, For the Lord desireth his work.

32.verse: And they that were sent, went forth, and found as he said to them, a colt standing.

33.verse: And when they untied the colt, the lords of it said to them, What untie ye the colt? [Soothly them untying the colt, the lords of him said, Why untie ye the colt?]

34.verse: And they said, For the Lord hath need to him.

35.verse: And they led him to Jesus; and they casted their clothes on the colt, and set Jesus on him .

36.verse: And when he went, they spreaded their clothes in the way.

37.verse: And when [now] he came nigh to the coming down of the mount of Olives, all the people [all the companies of men] that came down began to joy, and to praise God with great voice on all the works of power [on all the virtues], that they had seen,

38.verse: and said [saying], Blessed be the king, that cometh in the name of the Lord; peace in heaven, and glory in high things.

39.verse: And some of the Pharisees of the people said to him [And some of the Pharisees of the companies said to him], Master, blame thy disciples.

40.verse: And he said to them, I say to you, for if these [shall] be still, stones shall cry.

41.verse: And when he approached, he saw the city, and wept on it, [And when he nighed, he seeing the city, wept upon it,]

42.verse: and said, For if thou haddest known, thou shouldest weep also; for in this day the things be in peace to thee, but now they be hid from thine eyes. [saying, For if thou haddest known, and thou, and soothly in this thy day, the which is to peace to thee; but now they be hid from thine eyes.]

43.verse: But days shall come in thee, and thine enemies shall environ thee with a pale, and they shall go about thee, and make thee strait on all sides.

44.verse: and [they shall] cast thee down to the earth, and thy sons that be in thee [and thy children that be in thee]; and they shall not leave in thee a stone upon a stone, for thou hast not known the time of thy visitation.

45.verse: And he entered into the temple, and began to cast out men selling therein and buying,

46.verse: and said [saying] to them, It is written, That mine house is an house of prayer, but ye have made it a den of thieves.

47.verse: And he was teaching every day in the temple. And the princes of priests, and the scribes, and the princes of the people sought to destroy him [Forsooth the prince of priests, and the scribes, and the princes of the people sought to lose him];

48.verse: and they found not, what they should do to him, for all the people was [all] occupied, and heard him.

1.verse: And it was done in one of the days, when he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the princes of priests and [the] scribes came together with the elder men;

2.verse: and they said to him, [saying,] Say to us, in what power thou doest these things, or who is he that gave to thee this power?

3.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them, And I shall ask you one word; answer ye to me. [Forsooth Jesus answering said to them, I shall ask you one word; answer ye to me.]

4.verse: Was the baptism of John of heaven, or of men?

5.verse: And they thought within themselves, saying, For if we [shall] say, Of heaven, he shall say, Why then believe ye not to him?

6.verse: and if we say, Of men, all the people shall stone us; for they be certain, that John is a prophet.

7.verse: And they answered, that they knew not, of whence it was.

8.verse: And Jesus said to them, Neither I say to you, in what power I do these things.

9.verse: And he began to say to the people this parable. A man planted a vineyard [Some man planted a vineyard], and hired it to tillers; and he was gone in pilgrimage long time.

10.verse: And in the time of gathering of grapes, he sent a servant to the tillers, that they should give to him of the fruit of the vineyard; which beat him, and let him go void.

11.verse: And he thought yet to send another servant; and [also] they beat this, and tormented him sore, and let him go void.

12.verse: And he thought yet to send the third, and him also they wounded, and casted [cast] him out.

13.verse: And the lord of the vineyard said, What shall I do? I shall send my dear-worthy son; peradventure, when they see him, they shall dread [they shall be ashamed].

14.verse: And when the tillers saw him, they thought within themselves, and said [saying], This is the heir, slay we him, that the heritage be [made] ours.

15.verse: And they casted [cast] him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What shall then the lord of the vineyard do to them [What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do to them]?

16.verse: He shall come, and destroy these tillers [and lose these tillers], and [he shall] give the vineyard to others. And when this thing was heard, they said to him, God forbid [Far be it].

17.verse: But he beheld them, and said, What then is this that is written, The stone which men building reproved, this is made into the head of the corner?

18.verse: Each that shall fall on that stone, shall be bruised, but on whom it shall fall, it shall break him all to pieces.

19.verse: And the princes of priests, and [the] scribes, sought to lay on him hands in that hour [sought to lay hands on him in that hour], and they dreaded the people; for they knew that to them he said this likeness.

20.verse: And they espied, and sent spies, that feigned them[selves] just [which feigned themselves just], that they should take him in word, and betake him to the power of the prince, and to the power of the justice.

21.verse: And they asked him, and said, Master, we know, that rightly thou sayest and teachest [And they asked him, saying, Master, we know, that thou sayest and teachest rightly]; and thou takest not the person of man, but thou teachest in truth the way of God.

22.verse: Is it leaveful to us to give tribute to the emperor, or nay? [Is it leaveful to us for to give tribute to Caesar, or nay?]

23.verse: And he beheld the deceit of them, and said to them, What tempt ye me?

24.verse: Show ye to me a penny; whose image and superscription hath it? They answered, and said to him, The emperor's [They answering said to him, Caesar's].

25.verse: And he said to them, Yield ye therefore to the emperor those things that be the emperor's [Yield ye therefore to Caesar those things that be Caesar's], and those things that be of God, to God.

26.verse: And they might not reprove his word before the people; and they wondered in his answer, and held peace.

27.verse: Some of the Sadducees, that denied the again-rising from death to life [that deny resurrection for to be], came, and asked him,

28.verse: and said, Master, Moses wrote to us, if the brother of any man have a wife, and he be dead, and he was without heirs [saying, Master, Moses wrote to us, if the brother of any man having a wife died, and he was without free children], that his brother take his wife, and raise seed to his brother.

29.verse: And so there were seven brethren. The first took a wife, and is dead without heirs; [There were therefore seven brethren. The first took a wife, and is dead, without free children;]

30.verse: and the brother following took her [and the second took her], and he is dead without son;

31.verse: and the third took her; also and all seven, and they left not seed [and left no seed], but be dead;

32.verse: and the last of all the woman is dead. [the last of all and the woman is dead.]

33.verse: Therefore in the rising again, whose wife of them shall she be? for seven had her to wife.

34.verse: And Jesus said to them, Sons of this world wed, and be given to weddings;

35.verse: but they that shall be had worthy of that world, and of the rising again from death [forsooth they that shall be worthy to that world, and rising again from dead men], neither be wedded, nor wed wives,

36.verse: neither they shall be able to die more; for they be even with angels, and be the sons of God, since they be the sons of the rising again from death [since they be the sons of rising again].

37.verse: And that dead men rise again, also Moses showed beside the bush, as he saith, The Lord God of Abraham, and God of Isaac, and God of Jacob.

38.verse: And God is not of dead men [Forsooth God is not of dead men], but of living men; for all men live to him.

39.verse: And some of the scribes answering, said, Master, thou hast well-said.

40.verse: And they durst no more ask him any thing.

41.verse: But he said to them, How say men, Christ to be the son of David [How say men, that Christ is the son of David],

42.verse: and David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit thou on my right half,

43.verse: till I put thine enemies a stool of thy feet?

44.verse: Therefore David calleth him Lord, and how is he his son?

45.verse: And in hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,

46.verse: Be ye ware of the scribes, that will wander in stoles, and love salutations in the market [and love salutations in the markets], and the first chairs in the synagogues, and the first sitting places in [the] feasts;

47.verse: that devour the houses of widows, and feign long praying; these shall take the more damnation. [which devour the houses of widows, feigning long prayer; these shall take more damnation.]

1.verse: And he beheld, and saw the rich men, that cast their gifts into the treasury;

2.verse: but he saw also a little poor widow casting two farthings.

3.verse: And he said, Truly I say to you, that this poor widow cast more than all men.

4.verse: For why all these of [the] thing that was plenteous to them [For why all these of the abundance, or plenteous, to them] cast into the gifts of God; but this widow of that thing that failed to her, cast all her livelode [sent all her lifelode], that she had.

5.verse: And when some men said of the temple, that it was appareled with good stones and gifts [that it was adorned with good stones and gifts], he said,

6.verse: These things that ye see, days shall come, in which a stone shall not be left on a stone, which shall not be destroyed.

7.verse: And they asked him, and said [saying], Commander, when shall these things be? and what token shall be, when they shall begin to be done?

8.verse: And he said, See ye, that ye be not deceived; for many shall come in my name, saying, For I am, and the time shall approach [and the time shall nigh]; therefore do not ye go after them.

9.verse: And when ye shall hear battles and strives within [But when ye shall hear battles and dissensions within], do not ye be afeared; it behooveth first these things to be done, but not yet at once is an end [but not yet anon the end].

10.verse: Then he said to them, Folk shall rise against folk, and realm against realm;

11.verse: and great movings of the earth shall be by places, and pestilences, and hungers, and dreads from heaven, and great tokens shall be.

12.verse: But before all these things they shall set their hands on you, and shall pursue you, betaking into synagogues and keepings, drawing you to kings and to justices , for my name;

13.verse: but it shall fall to you into witnessing.

14.verse: Therefore put ye in your hearts, not to think before, how ye shall answer;

15.verse: for I shall give to you mouth and wisdom, to which all your adversaries shall not be able to against-stand, and gainsay [and against-say].

16.verse: And ye shall be taken of father, and mother [Soothly ye shall be betrayed of father, and mother], and brethren, and cousins, and friends, and by death they shall torment [some] of you;

17.verse: and ye shall be in hate to all men for my name. [and ye shall be hated of all men for my name.]

18.verse: And an hair of your head shall not perish;

19.verse: in your patience ye shall wield your souls.

20.verse: But when ye shall see Jerusalem be environed with an host, then know ye, that the desolation of it shall approach. [Forsooth when ye shall see Jerusalem environed of an host of battle, then know ye, that the desolation thereof shall nigh.]

21.verse: Then they that be in Judaea, flee to the mountains; and they that be in the middle of it, go away; and they that be in the countries, enter not into it.

22.verse: For these be the days of vengeance, that all things that be written, be fulfilled.

23.verse: And woe to them, that be with child, and nourishing in those days [and nursing in those days]; for a great dis-ease shall be on the earth, and wrath to this people.

24.verse: And they shall fall by the sharpness of sword, and they shall be led prisoners into all folks [and they shall be led captive, or prisoners, into all folks]; and Jerusalem shall be defouled of heathen men [and Jerusalem shall be defouled, or trodden down, of heathen men], till the times of nations be fulfilled.

25.verse: And tokens shall be in the sun, and the moon, and in the stars; and in the earth overlaying of folks, for confusion of the sound of the sea and of floods [for confusion of sound of the sea and waves];

26.verse: for men shall wax dry for dread and abiding that shall come into all the world [men waxing dry for dread and abiding that shall come on all the world]; for virtues of heaven shall be moved.

27.verse: And then they shall see man's Son coming in a cloud, with great power and majesty.

28.verse: And when these things begin to be made, behold ye, and raise ye your heads, for your redemption approacheth.

29.verse: And he said to them a likeness, See ye the fig tree, and all trees,

30.verse: when they bring forth now of themselves fruit [when they bring forth fruit now of them], ye know that summer is nigh;

31.verse: so [also] ye, when ye see these things to be done, know ye, that the kingdom of God is nigh.

32.verse: Truly I say to you, that this generation shall not pass, till all things be done.

33.verse: Heaven and earth shall pass, but my words shall not pass.

34.verse: But take ye heed to yourselves [Forsooth perceive ye, or take heed, to yourselves], lest peradventure your hearts be grieved with gluttony, and drunkenness, and busynesses of this life, and that day come suddenly on you [and that day come sudden upon you];

35.verse: for as a snare it shall come on all men, that sit on the face of all the earth.

36.verse: Therefore wake ye, praying in each time, that ye be had worthy to flee all these things that be to come [that ye be worthy to flee all these things that shall come], and to stand before man's Son.

37.verse: And in days he was teaching in the temple, but in nights he went out, and dwelled in the mount, that is called of Olives.

38.verse: And all the people rose early [And all the people hasted, or came early], to come to him in the temple, for to hear him.

1.verse: And the holiday of therf loaves, that is said pask, approached.

2.verse: And the princes of priests and the scribes sought, how they should slay Jesus, but they dreaded the people.

3.verse: And Satan entered into Judas, that was called Iscariot, one of the twelve.

4.verse: And he went, and spake with the princes of priests, and with the magistrates, how he should betray him to them.

5.verse: And they joyed, and made covenant to give him money.

6.verse: And he promised, and he sought opportunity, to betray him, without the people. [And he promised, and he sought covenability, that he should betray him, without the companies.]

7.verse: But the days of therf loaves came, in which it was need, that the sacrifice of pask were slain [in which it was need, that pask, that is, the sacrifice of pask, be slain].

8.verse: And he sent Peter and John, and said [saying], Go ye, and make ready to us the pask, that we eat.

9.verse: And they said, Where wilt thou, that we make ready?

10.verse: And he said to them, Lo! when ye shall enter into the city, a man bearing a vessel of water shall meet you; follow ye him into the house, into which he entereth.

11.verse: And ye shall say to the husbandman of the house, The master saith to thee, Where is a chamber [Where is the harbourgerie], where I shall eat the pask with my disciples?

12.verse: And he shall show to you a great supping place strewed, and there make ye ready.

13.verse: And they went, and found as he said to them, and they made ready the pask.

14.verse: And when the hour was come, he sat to the meat [he sat to meat], and the twelve apostles with him.

15.verse: And he said to them, With desire I have desired to eat with you this pask, before that I suffer;

16.verse: for I say to you, that from this time I shall not eat it, till it be fulfilled in the realm of God.

17.verse: And when he had taken the cup, he did graces [he did thankings], and said, Take ye, and part ye among you;

18.verse: for I say to you, that I shall not drink of the kind of this vine [soothly I say to you, I shall not drink of the generation of this vine], till the realm of God come.

19.verse: And when he had taken bread, he did thankings, and brake, and gave to them, and said, This is my body, that shall be given for you; do ye this thing in mind of me. [And the bread taken, he did graces, or thankings, and brake, and gave to them, saying, This is my body, which shall be given for you; do ye this thing into my commemoration, or into mind of me.]

20.verse: He took also the cup, after that he had supped, and said, This cup is the new testament in my blood, that shall be shed for you. [Also and the chalice, after that he had supped, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood, which shall be shed for you.]

21.verse: Nevertheless lo! the hand of him that betrayeth me, is with me at the table.

22.verse: And [soothly] man's Son goeth, as it is determined; nevertheless woe to that man, by whom he shall be betrayed.

23.verse: And they began to seek among them[selves], who it was of them, that was to do this thing.

24.verse: And strife was made among them, which of them should be seen to be greatest.

25.verse: But he said to them, Kings of heathen men be lords of them, and they that have power on them be called good doers, [Forsooth he said to them, Kings of heathen men be lords, or lordship, of them, and they that have power upon them be called good doers,]

26.verse: but ye not so; but he that is greatest among you, be made as a younger [be made as the younger], and he that is [a] before-goer, as a servant.

27.verse: For who is greater, he that sitteth at the meat, or he that ministereth? whether not he that sitteth at the meat? And I am in the middle of you [Forsooth I am in the midst of you], as he that ministereth.

28.verse: And ye [it] be, that have dwelled with me in my temptations; [Soothly ye it be that have dwelt with me in my temptations;]

29.verse: and I assign to you, as my Father hath assigned to me, a realm, [and I dispose to you, as my Father hath disposed to me, a realm,]

30.verse: that ye eat and drink on my board in my realm, and sit on thrones, and deem the twelve kindreds of Israel [deeming the twelve kindreds of Israel].

31.verse: And the Lord said to Simon, Simon, lo! Satan hath asked (for) you, that he should riddle you as wheat;

32.verse: but I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not; and thou sometime converted [and thou converted sometime], confirm thy brethren.

33.verse: Which said to him, Lord, I am ready to go into prison and into death with thee. [Which said to him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, and into prison and into death.]

34.verse: And he said, I say to thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow to day, till thou thrice forsake that thou knowest me.

35.verse: And he said to them, When I sent you without satchel, and scrip, and shoes, whether any thing failed to you? And they said, Nothing.

36.verse: Therefore he said to them, But now he that hath a satchel, take also and a scrip; and he that hath none [and he that hath not], sell his coat, and buy a sword.

37.verse: For I say to you, that yet it behooveth that thing [this thing] that is written to be fulfilled in me, And he is areckoned with wicked men; for those things that be of me have an end.

38.verse: And they said, Lord, lo! two swords here. And he said to them, It is enough.

39.verse: And he went out, and went after the custom into the hill of Olives [And he gone out, went by custom into the hill of Olives]; and the disciples followed him.

40.verse: And when he came to the place, he said to them, Pray ye, lest ye enter into temptation.

41.verse: And he was taken away from them, as much as is a stone's cast; and he kneeled, and prayed,

42.verse: and said [saying], Father, if thou wilt, do away this cup from me; nevertheless not my will be done, but thine [nevertheless not my will, but thine be done].

43.verse: And an angel appeared to him from heaven, and comforted him [comforting him].

44.verse: And he was made in agony, and prayed the longer [And he made in agony, either anguish, prayed longer]; and his sweat was made as drops of blood running down into the earth.

45.verse: And when he was risen from prayer [And when he had risen from prayer], and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for heaviness.

46.verse: And he said to them, What sleep ye? Rise ye, and pray ye [Rise ye, and pray], that ye enter not into temptation.

47.verse: Yet while he spake, lo! a company, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them; and he came [nigh] to Jesus, to kiss him.

48.verse: And Jesus said to him, Judas, betrayest thou man's Son with a kiss?

49.verse: And they that were about him, and saw that that was to come, said to him, Lord, whether we smite with sword?

50.verse: And one of them smote the servant of the prince of priests, and cut off his right ear.

51.verse: But Jesus answered, and said, Suffer ye till hither. And when he had touched his ear, he healed him.

52.verse: And Jesus said to them, that came to him, the princes of priests, and magistrates of the temple [and magistrates, or masters, of the temple], and elder men, As to a thief ye have gone out with swords and staves?

53.verse: When I was each day with you in the temple, ye stretched not out [the] hands into me; but this is your hour, and the power of darknesses.

54.verse: And they took him, and led to the house of the prince of priests; and Peter followed him afar.

55.verse: And when a fire was kindled in the middle of the great house, and they sat about, Peter was in the middle of them.

56.verse: Whom when a damsel had seen sitting at the light , and had beheld him, she said, And this was with him.

57.verse: And he denied him, and said [saying], Woman, I know him not.

58.verse: And after a little another man saw him, and said, And thou art of them. But Peter said, A! man, I am not.

59.verse: And when a space was made as of one hour, [soothly] another affirmed, and said [saying], Truly this was with him; for also he is of Galilee.

60.verse: And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And at once [And anon] yet while he spake, the cock crew.

61.verse: And the Lord turned again [And the Lord turned], and beheld Peter; and Peter had mind of the word of Jesus, as he had said, Before that the cock crow, thrice thou shalt deny me.

62.verse: And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.

63.verse: And the men that held him scorned him, and smote him.

64.verse: And they blindfolded him, and smote his face, and asked him, and said, Declare, thou Christ, to us, who is he that smote thee? [And they veiled him, and smote his face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy thou, who is it that smote thee?]

65.verse: Also they blaspheming said against him many other things. [Also they blaspheming said many other things against him.]

66.verse: And as the day was come, the elder men of the people, and the princes of priests, and the scribes came together, and led him into their council, and said [saying],

67.verse: If thou art Christ, say to us. And he said to them, If I say to you, ye will not believe to me;

68.verse: and if I ask, ye will not answer to me, neither ye will deliver me. [soothly and if I shall ask, ye shall not answer to me, neither ye shall let go.]

69.verse: But after this time man's Son shall be sitting on the right half of the virtue of God.

70.verse: Therefore all said, Then art thou the Son of God? And he said, Ye say that I am.

71.verse: And they said, What yet desire we witnessing? for we ourselves have heard of his mouth.

1.verse: And all the multitude of them arose, and led him to Pilate.
