2.verse: And they began to accuse him, and said [saying], We have found this [man] turning upside-down our folk, and forbidding tribute to be given to the emperor [and forbidding tribute to be given to Caesar], and saying that himself is Christ a king.

3.verse: And Pilate asked him, and said [saying], Art thou king of Jews? And he answered, and said, Thou sayest.

4.verse: And Pilate said to the princes of priests, and to the people, I find nothing of cause in this man.

5.verse: And they waxed stronger, and said [saying], He moveth the people, teaching through all Judaea, beginning from Galilee till hither [beginning from Galilee to hither].

6.verse: And Pilate hearing Galilee asked, if he were a man of Galilee.

7.verse: And when he knew that he was of the power of Herod, he sent him to Herod; which was at Jerusalem in those days. [And as he knew that he was of the power of Herod, he sent him again to Herod; the which and he was at Jerusalem in those days.]

8.verse: And when Herod saw Jesus, he joyed full much; for long time he coveted to see him, for he heard many things of him, and hoped to see some token done of him [for he was coveting of much time to see him, for he heard many things of him, and hoped to see some miracle be done of him].

9.verse: And he asked him in many words; and he answered nothing to him.

10.verse: And the princes of priests and the scribes stood, steadfastly accusing him.

11.verse: But Herod with his host despised him, and scorned him, and clothed him with a white cloak [with a white cloth], and sent him again to Pilate.

12.verse: And Herod and Pilate were made friends from that day [And Herod and Pilate were made friends in that day]; for before they were enemies together.

13.verse: And Pilate called together the princes of priests and the magistrates of the people,

14.verse: and said to them, Ye have brought to me this man, as turning away the people, and lo! I asking before you find no cause in this man of these things, in which ye accuse him;

15.verse: neither Herod, for he hath sent him again to us [but neither Herod, for I again sent you to him], and lo! nothing worthy of death is done to him.

16.verse: And therefore I shall amend him, and deliver him.

17.verse: But he must needs deliver to them one by the feast day. [Forsooth he had need to dismiss, or deliver, to them one by the feast day.]

18.verse: And all the people cried together, and said, Do him away, and deliver to us Barabbas; [Soothly all the company cried, saying, Do him away, and deliver to us Barabbas;]

19.verse: which was sent into prison for disturbing made in the city, and for manslaying. [the which was sent into prison for some sedition, or disturbing, made in the city, and for manslaying.]

20.verse: And again Pilate spake to them, and would deliver Jesus. [Forsooth again Pilate spake to them, willing to deliver Jesus.]

21.verse: And they cried out, and said [And they under-cried, saying], Crucify, crucify him.

22.verse: And the third time he said to them, For what evil hath he done [Soothly what of evil hath he done]? I find no cause of death in him; therefore I shall chastise him, and shall deliver him [and I shall deliver].

23.verse: And they continued with great voices asking [And they continued asking with great voices], that he should be crucified; and the voices of them waxed strong.

24.verse: And Pilate deemed their asking to be done.

25.verse: And he delivered to them him, that for manslaying and sedition was sent into prison, whom they asked; but he betook Jesus to their will.

26.verse: And when they led him, they took a man, Simon of Cyrene, coming from the town, and they laid on him the cross to bear after Jesus.

27.verse: And there followed him much people [Soothly there followed him much company of people], and [of] women that bewailed, and bemourned him.

28.verse: And Jesus turned to them, and said, Daughters of Jerusalem, do not ye weep on me, but weep ye on yourselves and on your sons.

29.verse: For lo! days shall come, in which it shall be said, Blessed be barren women, and [the] wombs that have not born children, and the teats that have not given suck.

30.verse: Then they shall begin to say to mountains, Fall ye down on us, and to small hills, Cover ye us.

31.verse: For if in a green tree they do these things [For if they do these things in a green tree], what shall be done in a dry?

32.verse: Also [and] other two wicked men were led with him, to be slain.

33.verse: And when they came into a place, that is called of Calvary , there they crucified him, and the thieves, one on the right half, and the other on the left half.

34.verse: But Jesus said, Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do. And they parted his clothes, and cast lots [Forsooth they parting his clothes, sent lots].

35.verse: And the people stood abiding; and the princes scorned him with them, and said, Other men he made safe; make he himself safe, if this be Christ, the chosen of God. [And the people stood abiding; and the princes scorned him with them, saying, Other men he made safe; make he himself safe, if he is Christ, the chosen of God.]

36.verse: And the knights approached, and scorned him, and proffered vinegar to him, [Forsooth and knights coming nigh scorned him, and offered vinegar to him,]

37.verse: and said [saying], If thou art king of Jews, make thee safe.

38.verse: And the superscription was written over him with Greek letters [with letters of Greek], and of Latin, and of Hebrew, This is the king of Jews.

39.verse: And one of these thieves that hanged, blasphemed him, and said [Forsooth one of those thieves that hanged, blasphemed him, saying], If thou art Christ, make thyself safe and us.

40.verse: But the other answering, blamed him, and said, Neither thou dreadest God, [thou] that art in the same condemnation? [Soothly the tother answering, blamed him, saying, Neither thou dreadest God, thou that art in the same damnation?]

41.verse: And truly we justly, for we have received worthy things to our works; but this did nothing of evil. [And truly we justly, for we have received worthy things to deeds; soothly this hath done no evil.]

42.verse: And he said to Jesus, Lord, have mind of me [Lord, have mind on me], when thou comest into thy kingdom.

43.verse: And Jesus said to him, Truly I say to thee, this day thou shalt be with me in paradise.

44.verse: And it was almost the sixth hour, and darknesses were made on all the earth into the ninth hour [till the ninth hour].

45.verse: And the sun was made dark, and the veil of the temple was rent atwo [and the veil of the temple was cut the middle].

46.verse: And Jesus crying with a great voice, said, Father, into thine hands I betake my spirit. And he saying these things, gave up the ghost. [And Jesus crying with great voice, saith, Father, into thy hands I betake my spirit. And he saying these things, sent out the spirit, or died.]

47.verse: And the centurion seeing that thing that was done, glorified God, and said [saying], Verily, this man was just.

48.verse: And all the people of them that were there together at this spectacle, and saw those things that were done, smote their breasts, and turned again.

49.verse: But all his known stood afar, and women that followed him from Galilee, seeing these things.

50.verse: And lo! a man, Joseph by name, of Arimathaea, a city of Judaea, that was a decurion, a good man and a just, [And lo! a man, Joseph by name, that was a decurion, or having ten under him, a good man and just,]

51.verse: this man consented not to the counsel and to the deeds of them; and he abode the kingdom of God. [this man consented not to the counsel and deeds of them, of Arimathaea, city of Judaea; the which and he abode the kingdom of God.]

52.verse: This Joseph came to Pilate, and asked the body of Jesus,

53.verse: and took it down, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth, and laid him in a grave hewn, in which not yet any man had been laid [in which not yet any man was put].

54.verse: And the day was the even of the holiday, and the sabbath began to shine.

55.verse: And the women following, that came with him from Galilee, saw the grave, and how his body was laid.

56.verse: And they turned again, and made ready sweet smelling spices, and ointments; but in the sabbath they rested, after the commandment.

1.verse: But in one day of the week full early they came to the grave, and brought sweet smelling spices, that they had arrayed [bringing sweet spices, which they had made ready].

2.verse: And they found the stone turned away from the grave.

3.verse: And they went in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.verse: And it was done, the while [while] they were astonished in thought of this thing, lo! two men stood beside them in shining cloak .

5.verse: And when they dreaded, and bowed their semblance into the earth, they said to them, What seek ye him that liveth with dead men [What seek ye the living with the dead]?

6.verse: He is not here, but is risen. Have ye mind, how he spake to you, when he was yet in Galilee,

7.verse: and said [saying], For it behooveth man's Son to be betaken into the hands of sinful men, and to be crucified, and the third day to rise again.

8.verse: And they bethought on his words.

9.verse: And they went again from the grave, and told all these things to the eleven, and to all [the] others.

10.verse: And there was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary of James, and other women that were with them, that said to the apostles these things [that said these things to the apostles].

11.verse: And these words were seen to them as madness [And these words were seen before them as madness], and they believed not to them.

12.verse: But Peter rose up, and ran to the grave; and he bowed down, and saw the linen clothes lying alone. And he went by himself, wondering on that that was done.

13.verse: And lo! twain of them went in that day into a castle [And lo! two of them went in that day to a castle], that was from Jerusalem the space of sixty furlongs, by name Emmaus.

14.verse: And they spake together of all these things that had befallen.

15.verse: And it was done, the while they talked, and sought by themselves, Jesus himself approached, and went with them. [And it was done, while they talked, and sought with themselves, and Jesus himself nighing, went with them.]

16.verse: But their eyes were holden, that they knew him not.

17.verse: And he said to them, What be these words, that ye speak together wandering, and ye be sorrowful?

18.verse: And one, whose name was Cleopas, answered, and said [to him], Thou thyself art a pilgrim in Jerusalem , and hast thou not known, what things be done in it in these days?

19.verse: To whom he said, What things? And they said to him, Of Jesus of Nazareth, that was a man prophet, mighty in work and word before God and all the people;

20.verse: and how the high priests and our princes betook him into condemnation of death [and how the highest priests and our princes betook him into damnation of death], and crucified him.

21.verse: But we hoped, that he should have again-bought Israel. And now on all these things the third day is to day, that these things were done.

22.verse: But also some women of ours made us afeared, which before day were at the grave [which before the light were at the grave];

23.verse: and when his body was not found, they came, and said, that they saw also a sight of angels [they came, saying, them also to have seen a sight of angels], which said, that he liveth.

24.verse: And some [men] of ours went to the grave, and they found so as the women said, but they found not him [but him they found not].

25.verse: And he said to them, A! fools [O! fools], and slow of heart to believe in all things that the prophets have spoken.

26.verse: Whether it behooved not Christ to suffer these things, and so to enter into his glory?

27.verse: And he began at Moses and at all the prophets, and declared to them in all scriptures, that were of him. [And he beginning at Moses and all the prophets, expounded to them in all scriptures, which were of him.]

28.verse: And they came nigh to the castle, whither they went. And he made countenance that he would go further.

29.verse: And they constrained him, and said [saying], Dwell with us, for it draweth to night, and the day is now bowed down. And he entered [in] with them.

30.verse: And it was done, while he sat at the meat with them, he took bread, and blessed, and brake, and took to them [and gave to them].

31.verse: And the eyes of them were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished from their eyes.

32.verse: And they said together, Whether our heart was not burning in us, while he spake to us in the way, and [he] opened to us [the] scriptures?

33.verse: And they rose up in the same hour, and went again into Jerusalem [to Jerusalem], and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,

34.verse: saying, That the Lord is risen verily, and appeared to Simon.

35.verse: And they told what things were done in the way, and how they knew him in breaking of bread.

36.verse: And while they spake these things, Jesus stood in the middle of them, and said to them, Peace to you; I am, do not ye dread.

37.verse: But they were afraid and aghast, and guessed them to see a spirit.

38.verse: And he said to them, What be ye troubled, and thoughts come up into your hearts [and thoughts ascend up into your hearts]?

39.verse: See ye my hands and my feet, for I myself am. Feel ye, and see ye; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see that I have [as ye see me to have].

40.verse: And when he had said this thing, he showed hands and feet to them.

41.verse: And yet while they believed not, and wondered for joy, he said, Have ye here any thing that shall be eaten [Have ye any thing here that shall be eaten]?

42.verse: And they proffered to him [And they offered to him] a part of a fish roasted, and an honeycomb.

43.verse: And when he had eaten before them, he took that that (was) left, and gave to them; [And when he had eaten before them, he taking the reliefs, gave to them;]

44.verse: and [he] said to them, These be the words that I spake to you [and he said to them, These be the words which I spake to you], when I was yet with you; for it is need that all things be fulfilled, that be written in the law of Moses [which be written in the law of Moses], and in prophets, and in psalms, of me.

45.verse: Then he opened to them wit [Then he opened wit to them], that they should understand [the] scriptures.

46.verse: And he said to them, For thus it is written, and thus it behooved Christ to suffer, and rise again from death the third day [and to rise again from dead the third day];

47.verse: and penance and remission of sins to be preached in his name to all folks, beginning at Jerusalem.

48.verse: And ye be witnesses of these things.

49.verse: And I shall send the promise of my Father into you [And I send the promise of my Father into you]; but sit ye in the city, till ye be clothed with virtue from on high.

50.verse: And he led them forth into Bethany, and when his hands were lifted up [and, his hands lifted up], he blessed them.

51.verse: And it was done, the while he blessed them [while he blessed them], he departed from them, and was borne into heaven.

52.verse: And they worshipped, and went again into Jerusalem with great joy, [And they worshipping went again to Jerusalem with great joy;]

53.verse: and were evermore in the temple [and were ever in the temple], praising and blessing God.
